name: atrium
description:
You're standing in a large open-space atrium on the ground floor of the Porta Rossa offices.
The smell of coffee and smart people hangs in the air.

The space is overlooked by open glass balconies from the floors above.
Looking around you, the area extends to the East and West with a reception area, seating, a library and a kitchen. North leads out of the office whilst toilets are to the south.
Lifts to other office floors also depart from here.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: These vast full-height windows run all around the ouside edge of the atrium area letting in light and giving a feeling of openness to the space.

inventory.name: violet
inventory.detailedDescription: She's usually at reception.

attributes.defaultResult:
You'll need to learn to fend for yourself eventually.
Try heading East from here.

inventory.name: balcony
inventory.detailedDescription:
The reinforced glass balconies here run along the inside of the atrium at each level above the ground floor.
You're pretty certain they're unbreakable but probably wise not to chance your luck.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Reinforced glass. As you'd expect in a typical office building.

inventory.name: smell of coffee
inventory.detailedDescription: You'll need to head to the kitchen.

attributes.defaultResult:
The coffee machine is in the kitchen.
Off you go!
attributes.smell:
Yup, smells like coffee here.
Good coffee at that.

inventory.name: air
inventory.description: smell of smart people and coffee
inventory.detailedDescription: As I said - smart people and coffee.

attributes.defaultResult: The place is full of 'em. Go explore!
attributes.smell: You detect the slightly warm, damp, youthful smell of Cambridge graduates.

inventory.name: button
inventory.detailedDescription: If you push the button, perhaps a lift may come.

attributes.defaultResult: $action press

inventory.name: screen
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's cycling through news, traffic reports and the names of visitors for the day.
Apparently the A14 is broken again.

Ooh! It has your name up there too - 'Welcome $player'.
At least someone is expecting you.

missions.name: destroyscreen
missions.description: It screams 'destroy me' (or perhaps that's just a hidden violent streak you have) but you'd better be quick about it before anyone sees you.

reward.message:
Did you forget to trash the screen in the Atrium?
Looks like you missed your chance now things are a little busier around here.
To be honest, it's probably better that you left it alone anyway.

fail.message:
Bad you! Sometimes you just have to resist your violent urges.
Just to make things worse you manage to cut yourself on the splintered screen.

missions.name: latte
missions.description: It's your first day in the office. Check in with Violet at reception and then head to the kitchen to get yourself fuelled up for the day with some sort of coffee.

reward.message:
Congratulations, you managed to get your coffee. That was somewhat more effort than expected though.

Still... no time to linger. Drink up, wake up and start doing your bit to help your colleagues out.
(Or not - it's up to you.)

If you've not done so already, now might be a good time to save your achievements so far.

modifyLocations.name: servery-food-bar
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery serving area.
The breakfast spread has been cleared away and things are quiet out here whilst the kitchen team prepare for lunch.

modifyLocations.name: servery-main
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery.
When mealtimes aren't being served you can still find people occasionally sat in here studying or chatting to one another although mostly it's just a quick throroughfare between the sales and development team areas.

attributes.detailedDescription: It's the type used in a bain-marie for keeping things like soup warm.

modifyLocations.name: servery-food-bar
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery serving area and lunch should be being served.
It looks like they're not quite ready yet. Hopefully everything's ok.

inventory.name: plate
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard white mass-produced dinner plate

inventory.name: plate
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard white mass-produced dinner plate

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain round china bowl

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain round china bowl

modifyLocations.name: servery-food-bar
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery serving area.
The kitchen team have cleared everything away for the day.
You'll need to raid the cereal supply or vending machine if you're hungry this afternoon.

modifyLocations.name: servery-main
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery.
All the food sittings are over for the day. The area has been cleaned up and returned back to its normal background activity level.

missions.name: endofday
missions.displayName: it's the end of the day

reward.message:
It's 5pm. Your first (eventful) day in the office is over.
Even if you're part-way through battling a particularly nasty bug we have a strict policy on sending new recruits home on time in their fist week so that's all for today. Off you go.

That's really not good. We've lost one of the team.
Workplace accidents do happen - but not usually in a normal office environment.
A fatality on your first day is a bad start to your career here.
Let's assume for now that the bodycount around here isn't your doing. Suffice to say something deeply troubling is going on here.

missions.name: partybus
missions.displayName: get everyone on the party bus
missions.description: You did a great job of saving the company. Time for a break. Get everyone onto the party bus before it leaves!

modifyLocation.name: office-front
modifyLocation.description:
You're standing outside the front of the Porta Rossa offices.
The weather has turned grey, damp and miserable.
A smell of smoke lingers in the air and the wreckage outside the office seems to be piling up.

You can't shake the feeling something is deeply wrong here.

inventory.name: smoke
inventory.detailedDescription: You can't see much although a hint of ash floats by in the breeze.

attributes.smell: It's going to linger in your nose and memories for quite some time.

reward.message:
Oh no, you're out of time!
The party bus is leaving and you haven't got enough people on board.
You rush out to try and salvage your efforts.
As you recover your breath outside and the bus pulls away you see a lick of flame through the windows.
Something's very wrong here.

You watch in horror before finally registering what's happening and dive for cover.
As the bus explodes into flames and a piece of shrapnel tears into your leg you realise it could have been so much worse.

You look around you for survivors. Anyone that made it out alive is going to need urgent medical help!

modifyLocation.name: office-front
modifyLocation.description:
You're standing outside the front of the Porta Rossa offices.
The weather has turned grey, damp and miserable.
A smell of smoke lingers in the air and the wreckage outside the office seems to be piling up.

You can't shake the feeling something is deeply wrong here.

inventory.name: smoke
inventory.detailedDescription: You can't see much although a hint of ash floats by in the breeze.

attributes.smell: It's going to linger in your nose and memories for quite some time.

fail.message:
It looks like you're doing well at getting people onto the bus. Great job!
It's often hard work herding people around here.
You dash out to the front of the office to check for stragglers and as you recover your breath you smell smoke on the air.
Something's very wrong here.

As precious seconds pass, you register what's happening and dive for cover.
The bus explodes into flames before your eyes and you realise you've just lured some of your new friends and colleagues to their doom.
Your senses slowly recover to a feeling of numbness in your arm and blood on your hands.

reward.message: You've probably kept out of the way long enough to go and chat to Jordan again without suspicion if you feel like taking on another 'job'.

Wow, you're boring! You've spent a total of 25 turns doing absolutely nothing.
It looks like you need some encouragement to get moving.

You're quite the explorer!
Congratulations, you've found every location.
You're getting pretty slick at this hunting thing. If you're trying to track others down you can probably speed things up by following them from now on.

Hey, that's some impressive adventuring!
You've found 100 locations.
Whoa, you're out of control. You need to seriously work on your anger management.
You seem to be a bit of a liability. Time to stop trashing the place maybe?
Stealing may be one way of achieving your goals but it really doesn't fit in with our values.

I like your attitude to learning, keep it up
Only three more items left to read!
You read 'all the things'!
You're quite a chatterbox. We like people who talk and collaborate.

missions.name: socialite
missions.displayName: talk to more people - only 15 left to go until you've met them all

reward.message: You really are getting about and meeting so many of the teams. Great job!
Wow, you spoke to everyone. That's quite a network you're building up.

missions.name: bff
missions.displayName: gain affinity from one character up to level 12

reward.message: You're making a real effort here. Looks like you've almost got a best friend forever!
We could do with someone like you on the first-aid team. You've got quite the healing skills.

You've really 'got it' with the healing activities.
(Although where that level of repeated injury in an office environment came from is somewhat worrying.)

missions.name: asshole
missions.displayName: really upset a lot of people

reward.message:
You need to sort yourself out, people here think you're becoming quite the piece of work.
We have a 'no assholes' rule here you know.

missions.name: lovedbyall
missions.displayName: make yourself popular with nearly everyone

reward.message: Wow. You're winning in the popularity stakes!

Although it's not clear exactly what you've done so far, some of your actions aren't making you popular.
Admittedly you can't make an omelette without breaking some eggs but you're treading a fine line here.

We'll give you the benefit of the doubt for now and assume you're ruffling feathers for the 'greater good' but consider this a reminder to consider the consequences of your actions.
You think you're quite the artist, don't you.

You seem to be writing quite a few notes.
Anyone would think you're destined for management.

missions.name: junioroccultist
missions.displayName: draw a pentagram on a floor

reward.message:
Hmm. It seems we have a budding occultist here.
You might be getting ahead of yourself a bit. Don't be surprised if people are little edgy around you for a while.

missions.name: scaryoccultist
missions.displayName: draw a pentagram on a floor and add blood to it

reward.message:
I'm really not comfortable with your behaviour (and nor is anyone else around here).
Blood and pentagrams are a bit of a worrying mix for an office environment.

Hey big spender!
We generally have a spending wisely policy here but you can expense up to £100 on anything reasonable.
You are spending wisely, aren't you?

You've made quite a bit of money there, great job!
We hope you didn't come about it through foul means though.

missions.name: collector
missions.displayName: collect and carry more than £100 worth of valuables

reward.message:
You've collected quite a lot of valuable stuff there!
Have you considered selling any of it?

missions.name: pickpocket
missions.displayName: steal more than £50 worth of valuables

reward.message:
Yeah...
...about all that money you've made.
That level of dishonesty will get you fired pretty much immediately.

name: atrium-seating
description:
You're in the atrium seating area.
People occasionally wander in and out of here, sit, chat, play chess, work etc.
It's quite a pleasant space dominated by a dining table and a very large potted tree.
Above you are the ever-present glass balconies that hang from the walls.

inventory.name: balcony
inventory.detailedDescription:
The reinforced glass balconies here run along the inside of the atrium at each level above the ground floor.
You're pretty certain they're unbreakable but probably wise not to chance your luck.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Reinforced glass. As you'd expect in a typical office building.

inventory.name: diningroomtable
inventory.detailedDescription: It's an antique style circular wooden dining table.

inventory.name: cake
inventory.detailedDescription:
Mmmm tasty and healthy.
Well, maybe not so healthy but it really is cake - no lie!
It's a pretty hefty cake.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's enough here for about $charges good-sized $chargeUnit
attributes.smell:
You bend down and sniff at the cake. It doesn't smell of much except sugar and baking.
As this is obviously meant to be shared around, you try not to be too obvious about breathing all over it.
attributes.taste: It's fresh, sweet and moist with a layer of buttercream icing and jam.

inventory.name: tree
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's an ornamental evergreen variety.
The twisted trunk spirals up about 35 feet into a carefully manicured crown of green.

attributes.defaultResult: You grab hold of the tree and attempt to climb it but the bark is too slippery and you fail to find any suitable handholds.

inventory.name: chess set
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a cheapish generic wooden chess set.

attributes.defaultResult: You briefly consider a game of chess with youself but decide there's more productive things you should be doing with your time.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Are you spying on the lawyers?

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: These vast full-height windows run all around the ouside edge of the atrium area letting in light and giving a feeling of openness to the space.

inventory.name: lawyer door
inventory.detailedDescription: Peering through the window you see serious people in suits looking busy and important.

inventory.name: chair
inventory.detailedDescription: You expect to find Morpheus sitting in it. It's surprisingly comfortable.

inventory.name: key
inventory.detailedDescription: It doesn't look familiar.

name: bike-ambulance
description:
You're in the west car park by the bike ambulance.
Russell that works here is your man to fix broken bikes when they need some loving.

inventory.name: bike ambulance
inventory.detailedDescription: It's an old converted NHS ambulance. It's pretty beaten-up but looks functional.

inventory.name: russell
inventory.detailedDescription: He's a generous and friendly chap. Bikes is his thing. Nobody seems to know his last name be he doesn't seem to mind.

missions.name: collectchrisbike
missions.description: Chris booked his bike in for repairs, you'll need to give Chris' bike to Russell.

reward.message:
You hand Chris' bike over to Russell.
'Cheers' he says.
'I'll stash this away for now and let Chris know when it's done.'
Nice one! Helping people out feels good, doesn't it.

name: buenosaires
description:
You're in the Buenos Aires interview room.
Despite containing all the things you'd expect of an interview room, it still manages to feel empty and clinical.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription: Sparse, clinical and white.

inventory.name: whiteboard
inventory.detailedDescription: Despite regular cleaning, there's still faint marks from long-disused whiteboard coding exercises and architecture diagrams.

inventory.name: code
inventory.detailedDescription:
It looks like someone has tried to write out the pseudocode for a string reversal algorithm.
Personally you don't see the value in that kind of old-fashioned algorithm solving question. Surely the answer is just 'string.reverse'.
When you came for a job here you did a pair programming exercise trying to fix a real product bug instead.

inventory.name: architecture
inventory.detailedDescription: It's pretty hard to see the details but it looks like the architecture for a basic ecommerce system with microservices and an event queue.

inventory.name: flipchart
inventory.detailedDescription: It's just a regular flipchart.

inventory.name: pen
inventory.detailedDescription: Not great quality but it's a blue pen.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard wood-effect office desk/table.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

name: camelids
description:
You're in 'Camelids'. It's had a fairly recent makeover from the facilities team to give it a Moroccan theme with comfortable seating and tasteful decoration.
It blends the function of a meeting room with the space to relax and chat.
One wall has a small shelf whilst the UX team have filled another wall with post-it notes.
A window runs the length of the room looking out over the atrium stairs.

inventory.name: plant
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's an ornamental evergreen variety (like most of the pants in the building).
This one's a generic yucca/palm/cactus type thing (nothing particularly interesting).

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Wave!

attributes.defaultResult:
You press your face to the glass and make childish signs through the window.
Nobody seems to notice and you feel a little foolish.

inventory.name: gesture
inventory.detailedDescription: You flap your arms and prance about staring at yourself.

attributes.defaultResult:
You press your face to the glass and make childish signs through the window.
Nobody seems to notice and you feel a little foolish.

inventory.name: sofa
inventory.detailedDescription: It's large, comfy, and somewhat squishy. The perfect place to relax or nap

inventory.name: shelf
inventory.detailedDescription: It's white and functional.

inventory.name: fez
inventory.detailedDescription: Is it socially acceptable to wear one of these?

attributes.defaultResult: The tommy cooper look doesn't suit you.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription:
Pretty standard office furniture.
It provides plenty of desktop working space for a large group of creative people.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They look like standard meeting room chairs although they're surprisingly comfortable and ride on casters.

attributes.defaultResult:
Seeing as there's a sofa in here to rest on you decide the best use for one of these is office-surfing.
You wheel around the room dodging obstacles for a minute or two before realising you're still on probation and there's every chance you can be seen by everyone through the window in here.

inventory.name: corner table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a pretty little wooden table in the corner of the room. It's here for aesthetics rather than function.

inventory.name: hookah
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's an ornate water pipe (a bong to those less cultured).
It looks unused

attributes.defaultResult: Publicly smoking a bong in the office (or even on the business park) is probably not a wise thing to do.
attributes.smell: Yep. Definitely never been used. They're a pretty clean-cut bunch here - honest.

inventory.name: notes
inventory.detailedDescription: You skim the dozens of post-its on the walls. Most contain phrases that are meaningless to you such as 'user journey', 'top of funnel analysis' etc.

attributes.extendedInventoryDescription: Amongst the jargon you find $inventory that you have a particular affinity for.

inventory.name: post-it
inventory.detailedDescription:
A note you found stuck to the wall.
You find it highly amusing. Someone else might appreciate the humour of it too.

name: core-area-east
description: You're in the CORE (DevOps) area. From a quick scan of the walls and monitors it looks like things are running well here at the moment.

inventory.name: walls
inventory.description: wall full of assorted project and team status information
inventory.detailedDescription: There's a bunch of graphs that go up and to the right. Everything must be great.

inventory.name: monitor
inventory.detailedDescription: They're all cycling through web site statistics and error logs.

inventory.name: zoe sharpe
inventory.detailedDescription:
Our one and only business analyst. She mostly works with the Core team but is also our most experienced first-aider.
She's a qualified forensic scientist but we appreciate the fact she work to help the living.

inventory.name: medical bag
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a small dark green canvas bag

attributes.smell: It has a sterile, medical smell to it.

inventory.name: first aid kit
inventory.detailedDescription: There's enough equipment in here to heal a few nasty wounds.

inventory.name: syringe
inventory.detailedDescription: It's still sterile.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: derek benson
inventory.detailedDescription: CORE team tester and specialist in the art of looking grumpy and happy at the same time.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: getchocolateforderek
missions.description: Derek wants you to find him some chocolate.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I'm flat-out on the Salesforce project and will need to skip lunch.'
'You don't have any chocolate you can spare do you?'

dialogue.response: 'Thanks $player.'
'No worries. I'd really appreciate it if you could find some though.'
'Any joy finding that chocolate?'
'Excellent!'
'I won't ask again but I'd still appreciate some if you find any.'

reward.message:
Derek tucks the bar of chocolate into the back pocket of his trousers and pats it happily.
'Ass warming!' he says and smiles. 'I hate cold chocolate.'
'Anyway, thanks $player. Much appreciated.'

name: core-area-west
description: You're in the CORE Project Management zone. The team have been battling the backlog of business requests and working their way to Cloud glory.

inventory.name: backlog
inventory.description: scattering of analysis documentation but nothing interesting
inventory.detailedDescription: You pick through the few pieces of paperwork you can see lying around but there's nothing that particularly interests you.

attributes.defaultResult: I think Brandon, Ben and Zoe need those, sorry.

name: creative-agency-area
description: You're in the Agency Den. There's a tang of creativity (or is that printer toner?) in the air and the sound of clicks being converted to cash.

exits.description:
You crawl into the small hole under Daniel's desk and find yourself briefly plunged into darkness.
After a second or so of vertigo you come to your senses somewhere outside.

inventory.name: desk
inventory.detailedDescription: On first glimpse, it's a standard wood-effect office desk but you feel an overwhelming urge to do a double-take.

linkedexits.description:
You crawl into the small hole under Daniel's desk and find yourself briefly plunged into darkness.
After a second or so of vertigo you come to your senses somewhere outside.

inventory.name: tears
inventory.detailedDescription:
They're the residue of tears of frustration - probably from years of dealing with email marketing campaigns.
Nobody should have to work with email marketing for that long and be expected to stay entirely sane.

attributes.defaultResult: Trust me, you don't want them.
attributes.smell: You vaguely sense a tang of salt and blood around them.
attributes.sound: Wow, that's disturbing. It takes quite a spiritual imprint to leave the sound of tears.

inventory.name: tin
inventory.detailedDescription:
'SPAM!'
It's an easy-open canned meat container - a leftover from an email marketing training course a few years ago.
It says 'best before end: November 2015.'
I thought this stuff lasted forever!

inventory.name: spam
inventory.detailedDescription: Processed meat. How bad can it be? Right?

attributes.smell:
It reminds you of something.
You wonder to yourself if cats like Spam.
attributes.taste: It tastes a lot like it smells.

inventory.name: air
inventory.detailedDescription: There's something uplifting about it.

attributes.defaultResult: It's just a smell, not something you can keep - except in your memory and imagination.
attributes.smell:
Sharpies. You can smell sharpies.
Sharpies smell of ideas!

inventory.name: clicks
inventory.detailedDescription: Even when there's nobody here the clicks keep coming.

attributes.defaultResult: If you listen, you might just get it.

name: customer-delight-central
description:
You're in the Customer Delight area - a large, open-plan office space.
From where you're standing, the most dominant feature in the room is a floor-to-ceiling glass wall decorated with LED lights.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.description: glass wall full of LED lights
inventory.detailedDescription: The lights are green! The product builds are all in great shape and tests are passing. What joy!

inventory.name: sofa
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's a large, comfy, and very solid-looking semicircular set of seats. There's room for about 5 people to sit on here.
It has high backs to allow for a team to have a decent conversation (or gaming session) without disturbing anyone nearby.

inventory.name: chris graham
inventory.detailedDescription:
Chris is our resident head of Test.
He's becoming pretty famous in the testing world and has even had people ask for his autograph.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: michael weston
inventory.detailedDescription: Michael's our head of Organizational Effectiveness.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: partytime
missions.description: Michael wants to organise a celebration

dialogue:
'Hi $player. That's quite a first day you've had so far!'
'I think it's time to take a break. When you're ready, come and talk to me again and we'll get something organised.'
Are you ready to go?

dialogue.response:
'Right, let's get this party sorted!'
'Give me one last shout when you're ready and in the meantime I'll get something organised.'
'OK. Give me a shout when you are.'

reward.message: Stop back in with Michael in a little while to find out what he's got arranged.

missions.name: partybusprep
missions.displayName: let Michael know you're ready to party.
missions.description: Michael's ordered a bus. Let's get people moving.

dialogue:
'Hi again $player.'
'That was quite a job with the zombies, thanks!'
'As I said earlier, I think it's time we all had a break.'
'I've ordered a bus to take us all out. It should be waiting outside ready to go.'
'Can you ask as many people as possible to go to the bus as soon as they can and then wait for the rest there?'
'Once we have a dozen or more of the team on board (including yourself), it'll be time to head off.'

locations.name: bus
locations.description:
You're on the 'party bus'!
It's a small hired coach - not much to distinguish it really.
You need to encourage as many people as you can to head over here to start our celebrations.

inventory.name: jeremy finch
inventory.detailedDescription: Jeremy is our head of Software Engineering.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: stephen cartwright
inventory.detailedDescription: He's our head of Project Management (or a pirate if you give him enough rum).

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: rumforthecaptain
missions.description: Stephen's team have just shipped a major release. He wants Rum to celebrate

dialogue:
'Hey $player.'
'I need a cheeky favour from you, if you're willing.'
'My team are just about to ship a new release but I forgot to stock up on the usual celebration supplies.'
'Most teams celebrate with champagne but we have a tradition of celebrating with something a bit tastier.'
'Could you track me down a decent bottle of rum from somewhere?'
'And don't worry, I'll pay you for it.'

dialogue.response: 'Great! I'll be wandering around the office. Come and find me when you've got some.'
'Well if you manage to get hold of any, I'll make it worthwhile.'
'If you find any around, give me a shout. I'd really appreciate it.'
'Hey $player. Did you get hold of any decent rum?'
'Perfect!'
'Maybe later eh.'
'You'd be doing the rest of the team a favour too if you could get some.'

'Hang on, this isn't the decent stuff.'
'Try again sunshine.'

reward.message:
Stephen opens the bottle and takes a large swig.
'Thankshh $player.' he says, 'It'ssh perfeck!'
He slaps a handful of money into your palm and staggers back towards his team area.
It's funny how many companies have a 'no drinking on site' policy. I think they'd struggle here given the number of release celebrations that seem to happen.
Let's hope there's enough rum left for the team by the time he gets back!

name: customer-delight-east
description:
You're at the Eastern entrance of the Customer Delight area.
To the West you can see a glass wall with LED build status lights. You feel somewhat drawn to their glow.

name: customer-delight-management-area
description:
You're in the dead-zone of Customer Delight between the glass wall and 'Jellyfish'.
There's a vacuum where the CEO and PA's used to sit although it's adequately filled by the presence of Jim Dobbins when he's around.

inventory.name: map
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's a crude map showing all three internal floors of the office and the locations of each meeting room.
You might want to download the picture for this one and take a good look.

attributes.defaultResult: You can't tell which way is North on here but it might still be useful.

inventory.name: brandon hamilton
inventory.detailedDescription:
Our head of Tech Comm's.
He has a pathologic aversion to misplaced apostrophe's (can you see what I did here?); He's also the ghost-writer for all the Feel-Good-Fund invitations.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: findbrandonsguardian
missions.description: Brandon wants to do the crossword. Find a copy of 'The Guardian' for him.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I seem to have mislaid my copy of The Guardian.'
'I've not done my daily cryptic crossword and feel like I'm getting withdrawal symptoms.'
'If you see one around can you bring me a copy?'

dialogue.response: 'Thanks $player. I think It's probably somewhere on the second floor.'
'Well, when you feel like being helpful, let me know.'
'Keep an eye out for it if you can.'
'Hey $player. Any sign of that newspaper?'
'Have you found my newspaper yet?'
'Excellent!'
'I won't ask again but I'd appreciate it if you can help.'

reward.message:
Brandon says 'Thanks $player.'
'I was starting to get the shakes.'
'I can work happily now.

inventory.name: jim dobbins
inventory.detailedDescription: Our head of Sales. Like a 6-foot-plus tigger.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: wig
inventory.detailedDescription: A disturbing remnant from the sales team beating their records and making their management team wear fancy dress.

attributes.defaultResult: Nope, that's really not a good look for you. (Or anyone for that matter)

inventory.name: maracas
inventory.detailedDescription: A reminder of one of our great days out and of Chris Warrington's musical talents.

attributes.defaultResult: They're really annoying. Please don't do that again.

inventory.name: arthur pennington
inventory.detailedDescription: The master of Customer Delight.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

name: customer-delight-north
description:
You're in a thoroughfare in the Northern part of the Customer Delight area.
To the East lies our customer support team and a couple of meeting rooms whilst to the West is a small break-out area.
North heads towards the 'back stairs' whilst South takes you to the main Customer Delight areas.

inventory.name: printer
inventory.detailedDescription: It prints and copies things (in colour!).

attributes.defaultResult:
You don't really have a use for any printouts or copies at the moment.
Let's not waste paper. You never know when you'll need some.

inventory.name: paper
inventory.detailedDescription:
Ahhh, the dream of the paperless office.
Maybe one day.

name: customer-delight-south
description: You're in the Southern part of the Customer Delight development area. This is where the SQL Source control team sit. They're probably all held captive in a meeting at the moment though.

inventory.name: build screen
inventory.detailedDescription: This one's cycling through project, build and release status pages for SQL Source Control.

inventory.name: chris warrington
inventory.detailedDescription: Great developer, exceptional musician. Part of our customer delight development team.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: destroymaracas
missions.description: Chris gave Jim something really annoying. Deal with it.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I think I made a terrible mistake.'
'After the last Porta Rossa day out I offered a prize to whoever could guess the full list of samples used in one of my tracks.'
'Unfortunately for all of us, Jim Dobbins won.'
'Now in addition to his boundless positivity he's liable to shake his maracas at people.'
'Can you get hold of them and quietly destroy them whilst nobody's looking?'

dialogue.response:
'Great! He's often hanging around the Customer Delight management area.'
'He's pretty friendly so as long as you've not upset him in any way (or taken anything else of his) you might be able to simply ask him for them.'
'Fine. Forget I asked.'
'OK. Maybe later?'
'Don't forget those maracas.'

reward.message: OK, so it wasn't the nicest thing to do to Jim but at least you've preserved Chris' sanity for a while.

fail.message: You know, refusing to help people out on your first day in the office is going to put you on the fast track to nowhere.

name: customer-delight-south-east
description:
You're in the South-Eastern corner of the Customer Delight development area.
This is the part of the large area occupied be the SQL Source Control development team.
One of the walls has been painted for use as a whiteboard.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription: Whiteboard paint seems like a great idea until you to try to use it for sticky notes or want to clean it. This one's seen its day I think.

name: customer-delight-south-west
description:
You're in the South-West corner of the Customer Delight development area. Currently this plays home to the SQL Monitor team.
There's another big glass wall here.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription:
The Monitor team use this as their Scrum/Kanban board.
Right now it looks like things are going pretty well.

inventory.name: joshua warner
inventory.detailedDescription: Self-confessed Eeyore. Kick-ass tester and PM.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: aileen emerson
inventory.detailedDescription:
A source of endless positivity, even when the world is falling apart.
Probably your best bet for survival in a zombie apocalypse.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: vial
inventory.detailedDescription: A small glass vial. The type used to carry medical samples.

inventory.name: first aid kit
inventory.detailedDescription: There's enough equipment in here to heal a few nasty wounds.

inventory.name: food rations
inventory.detailedDescription: A few days worth of rather dull but long-lasting dried food.

attributes.smell: There's hardly any smell to them at all. Just plain, grim and dry.
attributes.taste: Ugh. This stuff will do the job in an emergency but it's a lot like filling your mouth with carboard and foam packing material. Dry, tasteless and uncomfortable.

inventory.name: survival book
inventory.detailedDescription: Tips and tricks for survival in a zombie apocalypse.

missions.name: survivezombies
missions.displayName: learn how to survive a zombie apocalypse
missions.description:
Most zombie contagion is spread through biting. Those afflicted with zombieism are likely to lose control of their normal behaviours however there is hope.
If you are able to find and consume a source of antibodies it is possible to develop some level of immunity.

Furthermore, any carrier of antibodies who is subsequently bitten may transfer them to their attacker.
Thus speed is of the essence. In order to pass on immunity and limit the contagion, it is important to rapidly identify patient zero and all who have come into contact with them.
Be warned though that this approach is not guaranteed. Ensure you have sufficient food and medical supplies.
under NO circumstances should you engage in direct combat as you risk working the afflicted into a dangerous frenzy.

I'm sure you'll never need to know any of this, right?

reward.message: Well that was an odd read.

missions.name: supportfromaileen
missions.displayName: get help from Aileen dealing with Zombies
missions.description: Aileen knows what's going on.

dialogue:
'$player!'
'We need your help...' '...Urgently.'
'Listen, I know what's going on.' 'Take this, I don't have time to explain.'
'Search the wreckage!'
'It's happening!'

delivers.name: syringe
delivers.detailedDescription: It's still sterile.

delivers.name: syringe
delivers.detailedDescription: It's not reusable. Once the current doses have run out, that's it.

inventory.name: vaccine
inventory.detailedDescription: There's only enough for you here. You'll need to figure out another way to save everyone else as well.

reward.message:
Aileen hastily hands you a hypodermic syringe.
She turns to run and pauses. 'You need to stop them.' 'Fast!'
You feel your adrenaline rising as you rack your brains trying to figure out what the hell she means.

inventory.name: chris maddox
inventory.detailedDescription: Endlessly cheerful security guru extraordinaire. Keep him away from Rum and pub floors.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: fixchrisbike
missions.description: Chris wants his new bike serviced. Luckily there should be someone around that can do that for us.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I've just got a new bike but it's not set up properly.'
'I've booked it in for repairs but I'm flat-out all day today.'
'Could you do me a favour and take it for a service?'

dialogue.response:
'Cheers $player.'
'You'll need to search through the racks for it I'm afraid.'
'Well, thanks for nothing then.'
'OK. Maybe later?'

'Hi again $player.'
'Any chance you could help me with my bike now?'
'Oops. You'll need the key. Here you go.'

'Hey $player.'
'Have you been able to sort my bike out yet?'
'Really? I'm pretty certain you'll need a key first.'
'Oops. You'll need the key. Here you go.'
'OK. Maybe later?'

delivers.name: bike key
delivers.detailedDescription: You'll need this to shift Chris' bike.

reward.message: Chris hands you a bike key.

fail.message: Nice move $player. That's just one of many potential friends knocked back.

name: customer-delight-west
description:
You're on the West side of the Customer Delight development area - also known as 'User Experience Alley'.
This is where most of our UX staff in customer delight sit as it's right between all the development teams. There's a window to the west that overlooks one of the car parks.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: It's pretty much the same view as from downstairs - just one floor higher - people, bikes, car park.

inventory.name: tomato plants
inventory.detailedDescription: They're huge! But they're also rather dry and starting to wilt.

delivers.name: healthy tomato plants
delivers.detailedDescription: They're well watered and fruiting.

inventory.name: tomatoes
inventory.detailedDescription: They're ripe and ready to pick.

attributes.defaultResult:
You'll need to ask Francesca if you want her tomatoes.
If you wait around long enough, I'm sure she'll be back.
attributes.smell: It's funny, freshly picked tomatoes always seem to smell like cat pee to you.
attributes.taste: They taste red. It's an odd thing to say but they really do.

inventory.name: francesca vaughn
inventory.detailedDescription: Roaming UX redhead.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: waterfransplants
missions.description: Francesca wants her tomato plants watered.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I'm running UX calls all day today. Would you be able to help me out and water my tomato plants?'

dialogue.response: 'Thanks $player. They're on the window ledge near my desk.'
'Thanks for nothing then.'
'I'd really appreciate it if you can.'
'I know who my friends are, don't worry about me.'
'Have you been able to sort out my tomatoes yet?'
'Excellent!'
'I won't ask again but I'd appreciate it if you can help.'

reward.message:
Great job! I'm sure Francesca will be really pleased.
There's a chance these might be useful later.

fail.message: I know you're busy but a little help never hurt anyone you know.

inventory.name: aaron prescott
inventory.detailedDescription: Master of user experience and a somewhat problematic addiction to stationery.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: findadamstrainers
missions.description: Aaron soaked his feet on his way in. Help find his trainers

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I managed to get a soaking cycling into work this morning and can't find my spare trainers.'
'They're usually somewhere around my desk but they could be anywhere to be honest.'
'Could you do track them down and bring them back to me?'

dialogue.response: 'Thanks $player.'
'Well, I'll be around if you change your mind.'
'Keep an eye out for them if you can.'
'Hey $player. Any joy tracking my trainers down?'
'Have you found my trainers yet?'
'Excellent!'
'I won't ask again but I'd appreciate it if you can help.'

reward.message:
Aaron says 'Thanks $player.'
'I'm pretty sure nobody wanted to have to deal with me getting trench foot.'

name: darth-vader
description:
You're in the 'Darth Vader' meeting room. This is a really great space that it seems most people forget exists.
I guess it's tucked out of the way behind the facilities team in the furthest corner of the office.
It's bright, airy, spacious and has a great view outside.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer out of the window and look down to the office entrance.

inventory.name: whiteboard
inventory.detailedDescription: It's in surprisingly good shape!

inventory.name: pen
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a decent-ish black whiteboard pen

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's the kind you see in office boardrooms.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're fairly plain chairs. There's enough to fit a decent-sized team in here for a meeting though.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

name: east-bike-racks
description: You're standing at the South-East corner of the the office building.

inventory.name: bike racks
inventory.detailedDescription: There's dozens of bikes here. Are you looking for any in particular?

inventory.name: bike
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like Chris' new bike.

attributes.defaultResult: $action ride

name: east-car-park
description:
You're in the East car park. In the far corner you can see an area used for waste storage.
To the South are bike racks and a path running across the back of the Porta Rossa office building.

name: east-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're in the East corridor of the ground floor.

name: east-corridor-ground-floor-north-east
description: You're at the North end of the ground floor East corridor.
synonyms: east corridor ground floor north east

name: east-corridor-ground-floor-north-west
description: You're standing in a short corridor just outside the post room.
synonyms: east corridor ground floor north west

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It leads out to the reception area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: east-end-south-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're near the East end of the South corridor on the ground floor.
synonyms: east end south corridor ground floor

inventory.name: fire exit
inventory.detailedDescription: If you open the door, you'll probably set off an alarm.

name: east-south-end-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're near the South end of the East corridor on the ground floor.
synonyms: east south end corridor ground floor

name: enterprise-meeting-room
description: You're in the Enterprise meeting room. Mostly it's just another meeting room. Like most rooms at the front of the building it offers a great opportunity to peer through the window at the people coming and going from the office.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a long way down.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain circular meeting room table.

name: facilities-area
description: You're in the Facilities team area. They work tirelessly to keep the building running, clean, safe and maintained. Just don't annoy them, you'll regret it.

inventory.name: joseph baxter
inventory.detailedDescription:
He's like a short, stocky version of Brian Blessed.
He's in charge of what he describes as 'hard services' - the physical aspects of the building.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: plant room key
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a heavy, industrial-looking key.

inventory.name: gate key
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a heavy, industrial-looking key.

missions.name: beansinthepostroom
missions.displayName: Joseph's got beans for the coffee machine
missions.description: Joseph left a parcel in the post room for you to investigate.

dialogue:
'Hey $player.'
'A parcel arrived a moment ago with the facilities team. It's been through the wars a bit but we think might be for you.'
'I've popped it in the post room.'

inventory.name: parcel
inventory.detailedDescription:
The label's smudged and it's hard to tell who it's from or to.
With a bit of creative deciphering (clever you!) it really does look like it's addressed to '$player' but you're not expecting anything.
Maybe Joseph had you mixed up with someone else.

attributes.smell: Mmmm it smells of fresh coffee.

inventory.name: bag
inventory.detailedDescription: The label says 'Finest Software Development Coffee Beans'

attributes.smell: You can almost taste the coffee beans.

inventory.name: beans
inventory.detailedDescription: Development fuel. Almost enough to last a day here.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's enough for about $charges $chargeUnit of coffee
attributes.smell: They smell like pretty good quality coffee.
attributes.taste: They're bitter, crunchy and pretty low in nutritional value

name: finance-area
description: You're in the Finance team area. You really need to be nice to this lot. They sort out your pay and expenses as well as all the rest of the cash running through this place.

inventory.name: black book
inventory.detailedDescription: This looks like a bit of an eye-opener about the challenges of theft in offices.

missions.name: learntosteal
missions.description:
In any office environment you must exercise caution. Even trusted colleagues may be less scrupulous than you think, don't be a victim and above all, keep your money hidden.
It appears less scrupulous players might be tempted to steal from their colleagues.
Worse still, there's even been reports of muggings in rare circumstances!

reward.message: You've learned some new stealth skills. Best use them wisely.

name: first-floor-back-stairs-east
description: You're standing on the north-east staircase.

name: first-floor-back-stairs-west
description: You're halfway up the west fire escape staircase.

name: first-floor-cubby-hole
description:
You're in the First floor cubby hole.
The area is lined with whiteboards and there are assorted chairs and bean bags scattered around.

inventory.name: rum bottle
inventory.detailedDescription: A large rum bottle

inventory.name: cheap rum
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's pretty ropey. Best used for cooking and not much else.
I'm sure most people wouldn't notice though.

attributes.smell: It smells like a mixture of farmyards and paint stripper. Maybe that's why this stuff's sometimes called agricultural rum.
attributes.taste:
As you bring it up to your mouth the smell overpowers your senses.
There's every chance it's just fine but this definitely isn't rum designed for tasting

inventory.name: beanbag
inventory.detailedDescription: Very comfy. Not so easy to get out of once you're in place though

name: first-floor-cubicle
description:
You're in a first floor toilet cubicle.
The toilet is still refilling from a previous flush. You might need to hang around for a while if you plan on using this one.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: When you're finished...

inventory.name: latch
inventory.detailedDescription: It's useful to lock the door when you need a little extra privacy.

attributes.defaultResult: It's attached to the door. There's no obvious way to remove it.

inventory.name: toilet
inventory.detailedDescription: Pretty much your standard office porcelain.

attributes.defaultResult: You try a test-flush on the toilet before use but it just seems to be constantly refilling and not enough water for a proper flush. It's probably best to use another one.

inventory.name: brush
inventory.detailedDescription:
Be nice and clean up after yourself when you're done.
This one looks like it's been used recently (yum!)

inventory.name: article on software security
inventory.detailedDescription: It's entitled 'Take security in your STRIDE'.

missions.name: lotlsecurity
missions.description:
The article describes in human-friendly detail some of the most common insecure practices and vulnerabilities in modern software development.
The one you always remember first is 'sanitise your inputs'. Anywhere you don't have control of data coming in, make sure it can't do anything malicious.
There's a more detailed (if somewhat dry) reference online.

reward.message: Congratulations. You've learned a basic mnemonic for considering software security.

name: first-floor-fire-escape
description:
You're standing on the first floor of the rear fire escape. You probably shouldn't be here without a good reason.
The wind howls across the steel deck. Peering cautiously down over the railings you can see the smoking area and bike racks.

inventory.name: fire door
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a secure door. These kinds of doors usually only open from the inside.

name: first-floor-landing-central
description: You're on the first floor landing.

name: first-floor-landing-east
description:
You're at the East end of the first floor landing.
Through the nearby window you can often see some of the sales team relaxing.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: If this were a house, it'd seem odd having indoor windows.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's one of the main doors into the first floor working area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: first-floor-landing-west
description:
You're at the West end of the first floor landing.
Peering over the balcony you see people wandering about their business down below.

inventory.name: balcony
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer over the balcony and look down to the atrium below.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Reinforced glass. As you'd expect in a typical office building.

name: first-floor-toilet
description:
You're in the first floor toilet.
It's a lot like all the others here although there's a subtle difference in colour.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer closely at yourself in the mirror and wonder if perhaps the Porta Rossa diet is getting to you a little.

inventory.name: hand dryer
inventory.detailedDescription: These things are good but loud.

attributes.defaultResult:
You wave your hands under the dryer. After a while it cuts out automatically but at least your hands seem mostly dry.
You wonder how someone would be able to dry their face with one of these and reminisce about the days of 'real' paper towels.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: When you need to go...

inventory.name: soap
inventory.detailedDescription: After careful inspection, you figure out where to push it to make it work.

attributes.defaultResult: You push the top of the dispenser. With a little bit of slipping and repositioning you manage to lather and wash your hands.

inventory.name: basin
inventory.detailedDescription: Clean and with a supply of fresh water.

attributes.defaultResult: You rinse your face and hands in the sink. You feel clean and refreshed.

delivers.name: water
delivers.detailedDescription: No real nutritional value but great for thirst and plants.

attributes.smell: It's odorless
attributes.taste:
They always taught you in science class that water was tasteless and odorless. That's probably true for 'pure' water but this tastes just like water.
You wrestle with the idea of explaining what purified water tastes like to someone else but settle for accepting it's just water.

delivers.name: healthy tomato plants
delivers.detailedDescription: They're well watered and fruiting.

inventory.name: tomatoes
inventory.detailedDescription: They're ripe and ready to pick.

attributes.defaultResult:
You'll need to ask Francesca if you want her tomatoes.
If you wait around long enough, I'm sure she'll be back.
attributes.smell: It's funny, freshly picked tomatoes always seem to smell like cat pee to you.
attributes.taste: They taste red. It's an odd thing to say but they really do.

name: fishing
description:
You're in the slightly dingy and sparsely furninshed 'Fishing' meeting room. It's long, narrow and has glass walls on 2 sides.
Peering back outside you can see the facilities team area.
Now you really know how a goldfish feels.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Yep. That's where the facilities team sits.

inventory.name: facilities
inventory.detailedDescription:
You press your face to the glass and squint.
Is there anyone there?

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain white melamine meeting room table.
synonyms: plain white melamine meeting room table

name: flowers-a
description:
You're in the Flowers A meeting room. It's bright & airy in here.
If you want to use the AV equipment, forget it. Use the TV instead.

name: flowers-b
description: You're in the Flowers B meeting room. This is a great medium-sized room that often gets overlooked. Possibly because it's regularly closed off to be used for massages.

name: graffiti-a
description: You're in the Graffiti-A meeting room. The decor is amazing but there's very little natural light.

name: graffiti-b
description: You're in the Graffiti-B meeting room. It's all bright and shiny.

inventory.name: torch
inventory.detailedDescription:
'10,000 candle power' apparently.
How do they calculate these things?
What sort of candle are they comparing it to?
Anyway, it's certainly bright enough to to find your way around here.

inventory.name: batteries
inventory.detailedDescription: They're pretty chunky but fairly old-looking.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's enough for about $charges $chargeUnit of power

name: ground-floor-back-stair-east
description:
You're standing at the bottom of the north-east staircase.
There's an air of foreboding down here and in the past this area has been prone to flooding.
People don't come down here very often unless they're lost.

inventory.name: key
inventory.detailedDescription: It unlocks coffee machines.

name: ground-floor-back-stairs-west
description: You're in the bottom of the west 'back' stairs (despite it being at the front of the building).

name: ground-floor-cubicle
description: You're standing in a nice clean toilet cubicle. Fortunately the previous occupant remembered to flush.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: When you're finished...

inventory.name: latch
inventory.detailedDescription: It's useful to lock the door when you need a little extra privacy.

attributes.defaultResult: It's attached to the door. There's no obvious way to remove it.

inventory.name: toilet
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like it's in lovely clean, working order!

attributes.defaultResult:
You relieve yourself and give the toilet a rather satisfying flush.
You gaze at the water as it gently gushes into the u-bend and drift into a peaceful, calm place...

...You jolt back to your senses and remember you have work to do. Time to get going $player!

inventory.name: brush
inventory.detailedDescription: Be nice and clean up after yourself when you're done.

inventory.name: article on solid design principles
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's entitled 'Do Me a SOLID' (that's a terrible pun for an article in a toilet, right?)
and describes SOLID coding principles (something this game doesn't always adhere to very well).

missions.name: lotlsolid
missions.description:
'Do Me a SOLID'. What a great name for an article on the back of a toilet cubicle door.
You admit it does bring you a little smile.
It goes on to describe SOLID design principles in software development. It finishes with a reference to Wikipedia online.
(Seriously, don't ever read the source code for this game!)

reward.message: Congratulations. You've learned the basics on how to develop good software architecture.

name: ground-floor-fire-escape
description:
You're at the bottom of the rear fire escape staircase.
All around you are large gas and water pipes leading in and out of the building.
This area is occasionally used for storing tools.

inventory.name: pipe
inventory.detailedDescription:
They're painted bright yellow and blue.
They're a little tatty and rusty but despite this they look pretty much indestructible (which I'm sure you'll agree is a good thing).

inventory.name: steel gate
inventory.detailedDescription: This has the potential to be a useful short-cut.

name: ground-floor-toilet
description:
You stare at yourself in the bathroom mirror and muse over the form and design of the soap dispensers.
It's probably not socially acceptable to hang around in here all day though.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer closely at yourself in the mirror and wonder if perhaps the Porta Rossa diet is getting to you a little.

inventory.name: hand dryer
inventory.detailedDescription: These things are good but loud.

attributes.defaultResult:
You wave your hands under the dryer for a minute or so.
You feel like your hands have been assaulted by a horde of angels.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: When you need to go...

inventory.name: soap
inventory.detailedDescription: After careful inspection, you figure out where to push it to make it work.

attributes.defaultResult: You push the top of the dispenser. With a little bit of slipping and repositioning you manage to lather and wash your hands.

inventory.name: basin
inventory.detailedDescription: Clean and with a supply of fresh water.

attributes.defaultResult:
You rinse your hands in the basin and ponder on where all the water in this place comes from and goes to.
Hmmm.

delivers.name: water
delivers.detailedDescription: No real nutritional value but great for thirst and plants.

attributes.smell: It's odorless
attributes.taste:
They always taught you in science class that water was tasteless and odorless. That's probably true for 'pure' water but this tastes just like water.
You wrestle with the idea of explaining what purified water tastes like to someone else but settle for accepting it's just water.

delivers.name: healthy tomato plants
delivers.detailedDescription: They're well watered and fruiting.

inventory.name: tomatoes
inventory.detailedDescription: They're ripe and ready to pick.

attributes.defaultResult:
You'll need to ask Francesca if you want her tomatoes.
If you wait around long enough, I'm sure she'll be back.
attributes.smell: It's funny, freshly picked tomatoes always seem to smell like cat pee to you.
attributes.taste: They taste red. It's an odd thing to say but they really do.

name: incidentals-blinkpipe
description: You're in the space between Core and Finance occupied by the Blinkpipe team. Some of them look oddly familiar although you rarely actually come into contact with them.

name: is-area
description: You're in the IS area. The team here keep this show on the road. Anything you need, they can usually get it or fix it for you.

inventory.name: angelina morrison
inventory.detailedDescription: It's well-worth helping her out, you never know when you'll need her support.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

missions.name: teachprojectorrepair
missions.description: Angelina knows how to fix stuff. Get her help to learn how to fix a porojector

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'Would you be willing to help me out with a quick (but fairly urgent) maintenance job?'

dialogue.response:
'Thankyou!'
'It's pretty simple, I need someone to fix the projector in Poppy for me.'
'I think someone knocked it off of the table'
'Here's a bulb. You might need to do a bit of a repair on it as well though.'

'Thanks for nothing.'
'Let's hope you don't need anything from me in future.'
'OK. Maybe later?'

'Hi again $player.'
'Any chance you could help me out now?'

delivers.name: bulb
delivers.detailedDescription: A critical part of a projector. It's fragile, don't drop it!

reward.message: Angelina hands you a projector bulb.

fail.message: I bet you're always the first to make a fuss if things don't work when you need them.

name: jellyfish-meeting-room
description:
You're in the 'Jellyfish' meeting room. The carpet in here is a rather vivid green and the walls are a tasteful wipe-clean pale blue.
It's a not-to-subtle under-sea kindof theme.
Through the window to the north you can see the main office stairs.
You ponder who's going to spill their coffee out there today.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: It's bright green. Not really the colour of the sea floor but it lightens the place up a bit.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription: They're pale-blue and wipe-clean to act as a useful 'whiteboard' space.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: It's not the greatest view you could get from a meeting room.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard wood-effect office desk/table.

name: kitchen-first-floor
description:
You're in a small, open kitchen area.
Although we encourage eveyone to go downstairs for coffee, this is here for a bit of extra convenience and has the usual array of kitcheny-type things.

inventory.name: fridge
inventory.detailedDescription: It's red and shiny. The colour seems a little excessive but it does brighten up the area.

inventory.name: milk bottle
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a large milk bottle.

inventory.name: milk
inventory.detailedDescription: It's semi-skimmed. Just the right balance of healthy and creamy.

attributes.smell: It smells fresh and creamy
attributes.taste: It seems ok. Not like that nasty soya stuff that taste like cardboard.

delivers.name: white coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Milky development fuel

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky and caffeinated. Just like coffee should.
attributes.taste: You're pleasantly surprised. Given that this is office coffee, it's reasonably strong, warm and generally tasty.

delivers.name: sweet white coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Milky development fuel with added sugar

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky, caffeinated and slightly sweet.
attributes.taste: It's a little too sweet for your taste but I'm sure plenty of other people around here might appreciate it.

delivers.name: milky shreddies
delivers.detailedDescription:
Shreddies... 'Cereal in the daytime?!' 'Wow, I've never heard of that before.'
They're going a bit soggy.

attributes.smell: They have an oddly delicious malty smell to them.
attributes.taste: They're a rare daytime treat. It's hard to describe the happy feeling of jamming a mouthful of soggy shreddies into your mouth but it's rather good.

delivers.name: milky coco pops
delivers.detailedDescription: Sugar, chocolate, puffed rice and milk. They're starting to go a bit soggy and turn the milk brown.

attributes.smell: They smell pretty appetising. Sweet and chocolatey.
attributes.sound: You put your ear to them. They make little muted snap, crackle and pop noises
attributes.taste: The coolness of the milk combines deliciously with the sweet chocolate of the coco pops. Tasty!

missions.name: fridgedoor
missions.displayName: Remember to shut the fridge door after you use it

reward.message:
Thanks for remembering to shut the fridge!
You wouldn't believe the lack of basic common sense in some people.

fail.message:
Did you forget something?

Nobody appreciates the milk going off.
Please remember to shut the fridge door in future.

attributes.taste: I have no idea why you'd spoil a perfectly good latte by adding sugar to it but still... I'm sure plenty of other people around here might appreciate it.

delivers.name: sweet mocha

attributes.smell: It smells warm, chocolatey, sweet and caffeinated.
attributes.taste: The combination of coffee and chocolate is like a tasty bedtime drink that's designed to keep you awake instead. The extra sugar just pushes it over the edge to be a little sickly but full of energy.

inventory.name: cup
inventory.detailedDescription: It's just the right size for a decent brew.

inventory.name: cup
inventory.detailedDescription: It's just the right size for a decent brew.

inventory.name: cup

inventory.name: drinking glass
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a pint glass. Perfect for cold drinks and beer.

inventory.name: cereal box
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a typical branded cereal box. Hey - at least they buy the real stuff here.

inventory.name: coco pops
inventory.detailedDescription: Sugar, chocolate and puffed rice. That's all the food groups ticked right?

attributes.smell: They smell sweet and chocolatey. More like cocoa powder rather than snacks though.
attributes.taste: They're sweet, chocolatey and crunchy.

delivers.name: milky coco pops
