attributes.smell: They smell pretty appetising. Sweet and chocolatey.
attributes.sound: You put your ear to them. They make little muted snap, crackle and pop noises
attributes.taste: The coolness of the milk combines deliciously with the sweet chocolate of the coco pops. Tasty!

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a round, china cereal bowl.

inventory.name: coffee machine
inventory.detailedDescription: Given the right ingredients it makes a variety of coffees.

delivers.name: latte
delivers.detailedDescription: Development fuel for former hipsters.

attributes.smell: It smells of rich coffee and warm milk.
attributes.taste: That's a mighty fine latte.

delivers.name: sweet latte
delivers.detailedDescription: Hipster Development fuel with added sugar!

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky, caffeinated and slightly sweet.
attributes.taste: I have no idea why you'd spoil a perfectly good latte by adding sugar to it but still... I'm sure plenty of other people around here might appreciate it.

delivers.name: mocha
delivers.detailedDescription: Coffee and chocolate. What a combination!

attributes.smell: It smells warm, chocolatey and caffeinated.
attributes.taste: It's oddly comforting. The combination of coffee and chocolate is like a tasty bedtime drink that's designed to keep you awake instead.

delivers.name: sweet mocha
delivers.detailedDescription: Chocolatey hipster development fuel with added sugar!

attributes.smell: It smells warm, chocolatey, sweet and caffeinated.
attributes.taste: The combination of coffee and chocolate is like a tasty bedtime drink that's designed to keep you awake instead. The extra sugar just pushes it over the edge to be a little sickly but full of energy.

delivers.name: coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Development fuel.

attributes.smell: It smells warm and rich.
attributes.taste: It's surprisingly good for office coffee. Better than many chain coffee stores.
attributes.texture: Well it's not thick enough to stand your spoon in. Also... it's hot!

delivers.name: sweet coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Development fuel with added sugar!

attributes.smell: It smells warm, rich and slightly sweet.
attributes.taste: The black coffee and sugar balance each other well but it's still a little too sweet for your taste.

delivers.name: sweet white coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Milky development fuel with added sugar

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky, caffeinated and slightly sweet.
attributes.taste: It's a little too sweet for your taste but I'm sure plenty of other people around here might appreciate it.

delivers.name: white coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Milky development fuel

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky and caffeinated. Just like coffee should.
attributes.taste: You're pleasantly surprised. Given that this is office coffee, it's reasonably strong, warm and generally tasty.

delivers.name: sweet white coffee
delivers.detailedDescription: Milky development fuel with added sugar

attributes.smell: It smells warm, milky, caffeinated and slightly sweet.
attributes.taste: It's a little too sweet for your taste but I'm sure plenty of other people around here might appreciate it.

reward.message: That's a start at least. You still need to get your coffee though.

Wow, that was foolish. You've just made yourself one of the least popular people in the building.
Good luck getting help from anyone now!
Congratulations, you got the coffee machine working!

locations.name: crash-site
locations.description:
You're standing near the West car park.
It looks like a scene out of a disaster movie.
There's debris everywhere and a smell of burning plastic, aviation fuel and barbecues.
From somewhere in the wreckage of what was once a small plane you can hear a low moan.

inventory.name: wreckage
inventory.detailedDescription: A tangle of twisted, smouldering metal, plastic, broken glass and bodies.

attributes.smell: The whole area smells like a combination of burned plastic and barbecued hair.

inventory.name: venom
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like something was injured here. It's worth collecting some, chances are it might save lives.

attributes.defaultResult: That's a remarkably sensible idea but it won't do you much good. Zombieism is transferred through the blood stream, not the digestive system.

delivers.name: syringe
delivers.detailedDescription: It's not reusable. Once the current doses have run out, that's it.

inventory.name: vaccine
inventory.detailedDescription: There's only enough for you here. You'll need to figure out another way to save everyone else as well.

inventory.name: burned corpse
inventory.detailedDescription:
Despite being burned beyond all recognition it looks recently dead.
It continues to make occasional groaning and settling noises, I think it might still be cooking inside.

attributes.smell:
Not good.
I shan't do into detail - suffice to say it's not barbecued chicken.
attributes.taste: Whoa there. Are you some kind of sicko?

inventory.name: charred book
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like the tattered and charred remnants of a very rare graphic novel.

attributes.defaultResult:
Yawn... It follows the typical mass-market comic book plot.
Normal person has bad experience, becomes superhero. Rich person has bereavment, becomes evil genuis nemesis.
The usual.
Even in its current state, this one looks rare so it could be worth something.

inventory.name: daniel connolly
inventory.detailedDescription:
Like a cynical but gentle, marketing wolverine.
He runs a regular podcast on comics (along with Robin and Lou).

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: robin hastings
inventory.detailedDescription:
If you've ever seen Withnail and I; think 'Uncle Monty' but somewhat more dashing and a whole lot more 'wrong'.
He runs a regular podcast on comics (along with Daniel and Lou)

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: jordan marshall
inventory.detailedDescription: Odd. Nobody seems to recognise him. Maybe he's new too?

inventory.name: emergency first aid kit
inventory.detailedDescription: A one-off emergency first-aid kit.

missions.name: jordandies
missions.displayName: Aileen receives a note from Jordan (somehow)

inventory.name: handwritten note
inventory.detailedDescription: It's barely legible and spotted with blood.

missions.name: readnotefromjordan
missions.description:
Aileen.
If you get this note then chances are I'm dead already. I've been bleeding for some time and stashed this in our regular contact spot.
I don't think I'm going to make it any further.
I know you don't necessarily trust $player yet but this may be our only hope.
You need to explain what's going on.
Hopefully between you, you'll find a way to turn this around before it's too late for everyone.

See you on the other side. (And take care!)
J.

reward.message: It looks like things aren't quite as straightforward as they first seemed.

missions.name: jordanreachesmachineroom
missions.displayName: Jordan needs to reach the machine room

inventory.name: hard disk
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's a server hard disk. This one looks like it's seen better days.
Our IS team are pretty handy with these things though.

attributes.detailedDescription:
The servers look like they're connected to a console nearby.
One of the servers has a bay to install an extra hard drive into.
attributes.defaultResult: $action install disk in server

reward.message: Jordan (the spy) is dead! Let's hope that's the end of all our troubles.

missions.name: stealsketchbook
missions.description: Steal Stephen Goodwin's A3 sketchbook.

dialogue:
'Psst!'
'I've got some covert jobs if you're interested. Are you up for it?'

dialogue.response: 'Great! I'd like you to get hold of Stephen Goodwin's sketchbook and bring it to me (steal it or mug him if it's easier), I'll make it worth your while.'
'Never mind, your loss. You won't get another chance
'Whatever. Check in later if you think you're up to the job.'
'Come back when you've got what I'm after.'
'Have you got it?'
'Excellent!'
'Come back when you've got what I'm after.'
'I won't ask again but as i said before, I'll make it worth your while.'

reward.message:
Jordan says 'Nice work!'
'Here's £20.'
'Head somewhere well out of the way and and keep your head down for a while.'
'You'll know when it's time to track me down for another chat.'

missions.name: vanarrival
missions.description: Steal £100 worth of valuables from the company.

dialogue:
'I knew I could rely on you.'
'I've parked a van around the side of the office.'
'If you can load it up with over £100 worth of valuables, I'll double your money.'

locations.name: east-car-park-corner
locations.description:
You're standing by a medium-sized non-descript white delivery van.
It seems odd to be parked around the side here. Usually we receive deliveries around the front.

inventory.name: van
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a generic tatty old white van. It's had quite a few knocks and scrapes in its time.

attributes.defaultResult: You'll need to get in and start it first.

inventory.name: petrol
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like there's only a few pounds worth left.

missions.name: stealvaluables
missions.description: Steal £100 worth of valuables from the company.

modifyLocation.name: east-car-park-corner
modifyLocation.description: You're standing in the corner of the East car park. On the ground are the tyre tracks of a large vehicle that appears to have left in a hurry. Given the noise it made as it left, I'd disappear from here quickly if I were you.

inventory.name: tyre tracks
inventory.detailedDescription: They're too scuffed to see any clear tread marks but they're wide enough to be consistent with a medium-sized goods vehicle.

inventory.name: mouse
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like a house mouse. I wonder what it's doing here.

attributes.defaultResult: No matter how hard to try to catch the mouse it always seems to move out of your reach just in time.
attributes.smell: It's scurrying around too much to get close enough to smell it.
attributes.texture: Hmmm... Smooth on the outside, crunchy and squishy on the inside.

reward.message:
As you load up the van with the last of the valuables you notice a thick manilla envelope. On the front it just says '$player'.
You open it and discover a bundle of banknotes inside.
You hastily pocket the cash, discard the envelope and try not to look suspicious.

As you turn to leave, a masked man dives out of the bushes nearby jumps into the driver's seat and roars off in the van, tyres squealing.
It's probably wise for you to make yourself scarce for a while.

dialogue:
'$player. It's good to see you again.'
'Listen. I hope I can trust you on this. To be honest I don't have much choice - or time. I need your help. It's vital you pay closer attention to what's going on...'

reward.message:
Jordan pushes a small coin or medal into your hand.
'Here take this.'
'It's a symbol of trust for the group I work for.' 'It's extremely old, fragile and can only be given willingly.'
'Others in our circle of trust will imediately know you have it.'

As you close your hand on the coin you feel a short searing pain. Your mind fogs over and you feel the world shift beneath your feet.
You open your hand and discover nothing but grains of sand.
You brush the sand away and notice a sideways '8' symbol burned into your palm.
As the mental fog starts to clear to have a strong feeling of vertigo.

You hear a low droning noise followed by a loud explosion somewhere to the North-West.
Something bad has happened outside!
Now's probably a good time to save your game again if you haven't done so recently.

name: kitchen-second-floor
description:
You're in the second floor kitchen.
There's a space where once a coffee machine sat, and a whiteboard with evidence of the usual random office banter (you hate that word too, right?) but not much else here to tempt you to hang around upstairs now. Overall, it's a bit of a depressing ex-space.

inventory.name: space
inventory.detailedDescription: You'll need to head to the downstairs kitchen if you want coffee now.

attributes.defaultResult: The coffee machine is in the ground floor kitchen now.

inventory.name: whiteboard
inventory.detailedDescription: This looks to have been used as a random source of amusement for the teams that are shut away up here.

writings: Justin Beiber and his giant flaming sword

inventory.name: cloth
inventory.detailedDescription: It's slightly damp but should clean things up.

attributes.smell: It has that nasty smell of damp, old food and detergent.

inventory.name: first aid kit
inventory.detailedDescription: There's enough equipment in here to heal a few nasty wounds.

name: lawyer-lobby
description:
You're in the lobby of the resident law firm.
There's an air of bureaucracy, suits and books to the place.

name: library
description:
You're in the atrium library.
This is a comfortable area to browse our bookshelves full of the wonders of working with software.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer outside at the world. Not much to see from here though.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's custom-made with a fake rock underneath and a sword-sized slot in the top.
A plaque on it says something about a billion dollars.

inventory.name: plaque
inventory.detailedDescription:
Somebody has some strange ideas here.
It's worth a read for the sheer oddness of the writing in a modern software company.

attributes.defaultResult: It says 'Whosoever contributeth most to our billion-dollar revenue is rightwise born to pull out this sword of this stone and table.'

inventory.name: bookshelf
inventory.detailedDescription: They usually contain books on everything from travel to SQL server and from sales to C#.

attributes.extendedInventoryDescription: Amongst the hundreds of pages of reading material available you find $inventory.

inventory.name: other books
inventory.detailedDescription: They're not really of interest to you.

attributes.defaultResult: It's not really relevant to you at the moment.

inventory.name: book of porta rossa
inventory.detailedDescription: It attempts to describe the essence of what makes ths place tick.

missions.name: borgassimilation
missions.description:
It offers a window into the inner workings of the company.
New starters are usually given one before they join. (Did you forget your copy today?)

reward.message:
Amongst the whimsy and nonsense it describes 13 company values. Number 4 is generally one of the most popular.
It reads 'Don't be an asshole'.
I think we can safely say that's a good human value too.
(You wonder if there's any significance to the number 13.)

inventory.name: sales book
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a book on how to sell.

attributes.defaultResult:
...Most people are wired to please. As a sales person, you must work as a predator, how can you exploit that human circuitry in order to maximise cash...
...as you first engage with your victim look for signals of weakness. Where are their concerns and worries that you can play upon?...

Hmm. This is fundamentally at odds with the way we work. It's pretty disturbing that anyone would write this stuff.

inventory.name: coffee machine manual
inventory.description: maintenance manual for the coffee machines
inventory.detailedDescription: It includes schematics and wiring diagrams for how to repair and maintain coffee machines.

missions.name: learntorepaircoffeemachine
missions.description:
Blah blah blah wiring blah locks blah coffee blah beans blah milk blah.

If something is broken and you have the right tools and/or skills you can try repairing it.
Just don't go overboard and destroy anything you need and don't get caught breaking stuff deliberately.

reward.message: You've learned how to repair a coffee machine. That might be handy.

inventory.name: 50 shades
inventory.detailedDescription:
'50 Shades of Customer'.
Wow. That's a really bad pun for a business book.

attributes.defaultResult:
'As he took my hand my heart quickened and I realised this was a man who meant business.'
'His double-fist-pump hand shake meant only one thing...'
'SENIOR EXECUTIVE!'

As a working professional, you provide a service to everyone you interact with. The class of service you provide in these interactions is largely your choice but for optimum results you must determine a person's unmet need and establish if you are able (and willing) to help them fulfil it.
...furthermore, understand their role, their sphere of influence and the value of your relationship to them.
How can you both achieve mutual success? Not from a purely cynical or financial perspective but from a longer term holistic business relationship.
Don't let anyone fool you. Just because it's business doesn't mean it's not personal...

It continues switching between bad storytelling and business explanation and goes on to explain why not all customers are created equal.

I think it's meant to help you work with difficult customers and business relationships.
Although the writing style is awful, there's almost certainly some useful nuggets hiding in there for someone in a front-line, customer-facing role.
attributes.smell: Hmmm. You're sure that smell's familiar but you can't quite place it.

inventory.name: sword
inventory.detailedDescription: It's flimsy and fake-looking but kind of fun.

inventory.name: guitar
inventory.detailedDescription: The strings are a bit tatty but it's mostly in tune.

customAction.message: You attempt to strum a few notes but virtual music doesn't seem to be your forte.
I don't think anyone will be be playing it any more.

attributes.detailedDescription: It's not in any shape to play after somebody abused it.

customAction.message: I think the only fun anyone is likely to have with this now is burning or throwing what's left of it.

inventory.name: strings
inventory.detailedDescription: They're tatty but functional nylon/wound spanish guitar strings.

attributes.defaultResult: They look pretty worn out. They'll be no use as a garotte or tourniquet. Their only function is for making plinky sounds on a guitar so it's best to leave them alone.

name: lift-first-floor
description:
A metallic voice says 'First floor; Doors opening'.
You're in a lift on the first floor.
The cool blue-white of the LED lighting gives you a somewhat sickened pallor in the full mirror.
You try not to keep staring at yourself

inventory.name: alarm button
inventory.detailedDescription: It doesn't look like it's been used in quite some time.

attributes.defaultResult:
You hold the button for 3 seconds.
After a minute or two of ringing, a distorted voice crackles through the speaker. '~crackle... hello lift service, can I hel... ~crackle' and then dies out.
It looks like that service hasn't been tested in a while.
Let's hope you don't ever need it.

inventory.name: led
inventory.detailedDescription: They're a kind of baleful blueish white.

inventory.name: door
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just plain metal lift doors.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription:
With the white/blue-ish dark LED light, the full-length view of yourself and the enclosed space the view is making you uncomfortable.
This mirror seems to shed pounds from you leaving you looking gaunt, aging and unwell.

name: lift-ground-floor
description:
The lift doors automatically close behind you. You're in the ground floor lift. It's quite dark in here and every now and again a disembodied voice chants something about electrical faults.
You contemplate pressing the alarm button but it'll only route to a call centre somewhere.

inventory.name: alarm button
inventory.detailedDescription: It doesn't look like it's been used in quite some time.

attributes.defaultResult:
You hold the button for 3 seconds.
After a minute or two of ringing, a distorted voice crackles through the speaker. '~crackle... hello lift service, can I hel... ~crackle' and then dies out.
It looks like that service hasn't been tested in a while.
Let's hope you don't ever need it.

inventory.name: exit button
inventory.detailedDescription: If you push the exit, you should be able to get out again.

inventory.name: led
inventory.detailedDescription: They're blueish white low-energy replacement bulbs.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription: Something about this view troubles you.

name: lift-second-floor
description:
Ding. Second floor.
Same lift, same mirror, same eerie lighting. Or is it?

inventory.name: alarm button
inventory.detailedDescription: It doesn't look like it's been used in quite some time.

attributes.defaultResult:
You hold the button for 3 seconds.
After a minute or two of ringing, a distorted voice crackles through the speaker. '~crackle... hello lift service, can I hel... ~crackle' and then dies out.
It looks like that service hasn't been tested in a while.
Let's hope you don't ever need it.

inventory.name: led
inventory.detailedDescription:
They're a kind of baleful blueish white.
Some years ago the original lights were stolen. (What a thing to steal from an office!)
These are low-energy replacements but they remind you of the lights used in the toilets of seedier pubs and clubs to prevent unsavoury activities.

inventory.name: door
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just plain metal lift doors.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription:
With the white/blue-ish dark LED light, the full-length view of yourself and the enclosed space the view is making you uncomfortable.
This mirror seems to shed pounds from you leaving you looking gaunt, aging and unwell.

Hang on! Is that your eyes playing tricks on you or did the mirror just shimmer and your reflection move on its own?

inventory.name: reflection
inventory.detailedDescription:
You stare deeply into your reflection and shudder to yourself.
You're just imagining things.

name: machine-room-east
description: Now you're definitely in a sensitive area. Racks of servers hum away. Fortunately most of them are just for testing, we use the cloud you know!

inventory.name: server
inventory.detailedDescription: The servers look like they're connected to a console nearby.

missions.name: installdisk
missions.displayName: install a hard disk in the machine room server

attributes.detailedDescription:
It's a really old-style green screen (or at least it's made to look like one).
It's continuously paging through data from somewhere.

You scan the contents as they run past and pick up the odd mangled word and phrase.
'...I 5_!£_ 6!£¬_$@th call for¬@£^ the C~#t of !£* R£@ G~#@'...
...'book of summ!£*_+g...
...sacri+}[@: souls open _^* gate'...
...'eternal ¬~@#'...

There's much more to this place than just a software company. If only you'd read the small print on your employment contract.

Let's assume not everyone here is a willing participant in this - and from what you can gather here, the consequences of whatever's going on are unlikely to be localised to just this building.
The servers look like they can be accessed via a console nearby.

reward.message:
You slot the disk into the server hard drive bay. It clicks permanently into place and spins up.
You hear a small 'beep' from nearby. Let's find out what was on that disk.

inventory.name: console
inventory.detailedDescription: It's pretty old and tatty. There's no sign of life in it at the moment.

name: machine-room-west
description:
You're in the IS storage area.
You're not meant to be in here unaccompanied I think. There are cables, wires, tools and spare pieces of hardware arrayed around you.

inventory.name: hardware
inventory.detailedDescription: Most of this stuff looks old, broken or redundant.

attributes.defaultResult: There's little or nothing here of any use to you at the moment.

inventory.name: screwdriver
inventory.detailedDescription: It's too large for working on electronics but I'm sure it has other uses.

name: marketing
description: You're in the Marketing area.

name: mercedes
description:
You're in the Mercedes meeting room. It's a small, odd-shaped room that's rarely used by anyone but the locals.
In fact these days it's used more than anything else for raucous games of Mariokart.
The lack of seating in here ensures people don't camp out for too long though.

inventory.name: tv
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a 40 inch screen used solely for gaming.

inventory.name: wii
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a Wii U. The only game played on it here is Super Mariokart - but hey, what else do you need?

attributes.defaultResult:
Brum. Bruuuum. BRRRRUUUUUUM!
After a few minutes of button-mashing alone you think it's probably time to go and do something useful instead.

name: northwest-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're in the West corridor of the ground floor.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It leads out to the atrium area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: office-front
description:
You're standing outside the front of the Porta Rossa offices.
The sun is shining and the business park security and maintenance crews are all busy doing their regular rounds.
South leads into the main office building, while outside there are footpaths and car parks to both the east and west.

inventory.name: ice cream man
inventory.detailedDescription: A random guy who occasionally has ice cream for sale.

sells.name: ice cream
sells.detailedDescription: Ice cream makes a great gift!

attributes.smell: There's a hint of vanilla and chocolate to it.
attributes.taste: You lick at the ice cream. It's sweet, cold and delicious in a processed artificial non-dairy vanilla flavouring sort of way.

missions.name: freeicecream
missions.description: The Ice cream man wants to give you a free sample.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'Would you like an ice cream?'

dialogue.response: 'Here you go!'

'No strings attached, honest!'
'Are you sure?'
'Maybe later then.'
'How about that ice cream now?'

'You people amaze me.'
'Maybe you have trust issues or something.'
'Nevermind... Your loss.'

'Hah! I thought you might change your mind.'
'Here you are.'
He smiles broadly as he hands you over an ice cream.
'No worries. Maybe later if I'm still about.'

Fair enough I guess.'
'Never mind'... ...'it's your loss.'

delivers.name: ice cream
delivers.detailedDescription: Ice cream makes a great gift!

attributes.smell: There's a hint of vanilla and chocolate to it.
attributes.taste: You lick at the ice cream. It's sweet, cold and delicious in a processed artificial non-dairy vanilla flavouring sort of way.

reward.message:
'Enjoy!'
You accepted a free ice cream, that was smart.
If only everything in life were this easy.

fail.message:
Too bad. A free ice cream might have been useful.
Ah well, on with the work.

missions.name: healbusvictims
missions.displayName: heal the survivors from the bus explosion
missions.description:
Things just seem to be getting worse for you.
You need to save lives - fast. Time to triage and heal the wounded, I hope you've got a medical kit handy.

reward.message:
Geat work. You managed to prevent any further loss of life.
The chain of near-fatal incidents is just too much to be a coincidence now though.

Michael ordered those buses. It's probably best to start with him.

fail.message:
You failed to save eveyone. They trusted you today and you've let them down.
Office fatalities in the software industry are pretty rare.

It's time you tried to redeem yourself and figure out what's going on.
Based on your poor performance so far there's a strong chance you'll struggle though.

name: opportunities-central
description: You're standing next to a large floor-to-ceiling glass wall in middle of the opportunities and ventures area.

inventory.name: sofa
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's a large, comfy, and very solid-looking semicircular set of seats. There's room for about 5 people to sit on here.
It has high backs to allow for a team to have a decent conversation (or gaming session) without disturbing anyone nearby.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription: One one side this is used by the SQL Release team for planning and tracking work. On the other it's a working space for figuring 'stuff' out. (Stuff is important!)

name: opportunities-cubbyhole
description: You're in a dead-end room full of clutter in the opportunities and ventures area.

inventory.name: nerf gun
inventory.detailedDescription: An unlucky shot with this could take someone's eye out.

inventory.name: dart
inventory.detailedDescription: Ping, squeee, ouch, grrr.

inventory.name: drums
inventory.detailedDescription: An electronic drum kit, cool!

attributes.defaultResult: You bash the drums for a while. Your sense of rhythm feels a bit off today.

name: opportunities-east

'Hi $player.'
'Can you give me a hand?'
'I'm running a workshop later today but I'm running low on post-it notes.'
'Could you bring me some from the stationary cupboard when you get a chance?'

dialogue.response: 'Great! I'll be somewhere around the office. Come and find me when you've got them.'
'Well if you manage to find any, track me down.'
'If you manage to find any, track me down. I'd really appreciate it.'
'Hey $player. Did you manage to find any stickies?'
'Awesome.'
'Well if you manage to find any, track me down.'
'It really would be a big help if you could find them.'

reward.message:
Chris says 'Brilliant. Thanks for the help.'
Congratulations. You facilitated the facilitator!

You're standing in part of the opportunities and ventures area.
Peering through a window to the West you see staff wandering past on their way to and from their bikes.

name: paint-pots
description:
You're in the Paint Pots meeting room. The lack of visible light adds to the sense of foreboding.
You feel like this is a room specially reserved for difficult HR conversations. You'd be wrong of course!

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard wood-effect office desk/table.

inventory.name: folder
inventory.detailedDescription: Leafing through the contents, it appears to be folder of notes on working effectively with others.

missions.name: workingwithothers
missions.description:
Whilst in the real world working relationships are not transactional, working well with others here is largely about give and take.
The more you give, the more help you can ask for.
Be aware however that your kind deeds won't be remembered forever.
Acts of violence or unwanted attention will not be tolerated.
Those in favour can ask a friend where someone else is. They may also be able to ask individuals or everyone to wait for them or to go to places.
Colleagues with exceptionally strong working relationships may even support you in times of danger and need.

reward.message: It looks like you've picked up a few hints on how to work more effectively with those around you!

name: peacock
description: You're in the Peacock meeting room. Other than meetings, this room doubles as a miniature recording studio.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer out of the window and look out to the office entrance.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're just standard office chairs.

They always taught you in science class that water was tasteless and odorless. That's probably true for 'pure' water but this tastes just like water.
You wrestle with the idea of explaining what purified water tastes like to someone else but settle for accepting it's just water.

delivers.name: healthy tomato plants

You'll need to ask Francesca if you want her tomatoes.
If you wait around long enough, I'm sure she'll be back.
attributes.smell: It's funny, freshly picked tomatoes always seem to smell like cat pee to you.
attributes.taste: They taste red. It's an odd thing to say but they really do.

Great job! Next time there's a meeting in here, nobody will curse the previous occupants.
Curses can only lead to bad things!

inventory.name: stephen goodwin

inventory.name: sketchbook
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like it contains all Stephen's plans.

missions.name: readstephensplans
missions.description:
After thumbing through a few pages of revenue and budget forecasts you stumble onto something odd.

There's a sketch of the building's floorplan but the rear fire escape area doesn't quite look right.
Significantly more disturbing are the annotations.
You can easily distinguish a series of ornate pentagrams marked on one location but can't decipher the handwriting alongside them.
You manage to make out a few letters at best... 'R_t___ o_ __mmo_in_', 'D__w_ i_ _h_ b__o_ _f a s__r_f___' .

This can't be good.

reward.message: It looks like Stephen's company expansion plans aren't within normal company health parameters. Might be wise to <i>dig<i> a little deeper.

missions.name: retrievedisk
missions.description: Retrieve a stolen hard drive for Stephen the CEO.

dialogue:
'$player, things are getting worse.'
'We have another serious problem. In the wake of the crash, someone's been stealing our data.'
'I believe the culprit is still in the area and hasn't been able to offload it to anyone.'
'Can you track it down and bring it back to me?'

dialogue.response:
'Good... I think there's a spy somewhere in the building.'
'Track them down and investivate the situation.'

Refusing a polite but important request from your CEO probably isn't wise.
'Well, when you're ready to actually do something useful, you know where I am.'
'Keep an eye out for suspicious activity and if you track down anything, I'm sure we can make it worth your while.'
'About that missing data...'
'Have you found my missing data yet?'
'Excellent, hand it over please.'
'Fine. I won't ask you again but the request still stands.'

reward.message:
Stephen says 'Amaaazing!' and waves his arms in a CEO-like gesture.
Congratulations. You retrieved the stolen hard drive! Have a cash bonus.
'If you've not done so already, I think you should double-check to ensure our problematic friend gives us no more trouble. (if you get my gist).'

fail.message:
That was foolish. The hard disk was worth a lot in the right hands.
Well. Best you move on and see if you can redeem yourself elsewhere.

name: post-room
description:
You're in the post room.
Dotted around the shelves and floor are parcels of all sizes.
One of the great things about this place is that the reception staff are willing to take deliveries for all staff.
It means most stuff in the post room is from Amazon or similar and Christmas is a bit crazy but it beats waiting at home for a delivery.

inventory.detailedDescription: Big, small, round, heavy, light. Parcels galore but none of them are yours.

attributes.defaultResult: These ones aren't yours!

inventory.name: post room first aid kit
inventory.detailedDescription: This is meant to be kept in the post room for emergencies.

inventory.name: floor safe
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a small heavy-duty floor safe.

customAction.message: It's pretty much indestructable. You'll just have to imagine what's in there for now.

You briefly close your eyes and picture a door to a magical world full of love, rainbows, unicorns, and daisies.
Then you snap back to reality ('Oop there goes gravity').
You waver for a moment before remembering that you're still stuck in this office with a job and need to pay your rent.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a standard wood-effect office desk/table.

Assorted notes, framed insurance and health and safety certificates etc.
There's nothing of particular interest among them for you though.

The reinforced glass balconies here run along the inside of the atrium at each level above the ground floor.
You're pretty certain they're unbreakable but probably wise not to chance your luck.

inventory.name: window

inventory.name: reception desk

Porta Rossa seems to have more left-handed people than a 'normal' office.
Perhaps there's something sinister going on.

'Thanks $player!'

These books are unwanted for a reason - usually out of date and irrelevant.
Don't bother.

delivers.detailedDescription:
Mmmm tasty and loaded with calories. This is the kind of wonderful milk chocolate that you can still only buy in the UK.
Purists may disagree but you think this is the best sort for comfort eating.

attributes.smell: It has a comforting smell that reminds you of your childhood packed lunches. It brings memories flooding back of pulling all the chocolate off of your Twix biscuit bars with your fingers just to have a lump of neat caramel and chocolate to eat.
attributes.taste: Nothing beats good old English milk chocolate for taste. Sickly sweet, slightly milky and no sign of bitterness.

delivers.name: crisps
delivers.detailedDescription:
'Potato chips' to our friends in America.
Sadly the pink packet makes it clear these aren't Salt & Vinegar flavour but they'll do in an emergency.

attributes.smell: Hmmm. They smell oddly fishy
attributes.taste: They're oddly sweet and tangy. You're pretty sure they're loaded with MSG but there's something appealing about them.

name: roof

You're on the roof. With a bit of investment this would make a great roof terrace and bar.
However at the moment it's simply an open space with no safety rail - probably best you don't spend too long up here!

inventory.name: plant room door
inventory.detailedDescription: Nobody ever seems to come up here. I wonder what's in there.

description: You're in Room 404. It's like a giant 'notfound' error staring at you from beneath a bowler hat.

You clamber around in the skip.
After putting your hand in something slimy and nearly impaling yourself on a broken chair you decide to climb back out.

inventory.detailedDescription:
It's rusty and old but still extremely sharp.
Is that dried blood on the hilt?

The texture of the cover gives you a slightly uncomfortable feeling.
The flyleaf simply says 'To Neil'. Further inspection reveals a heavily faded title; 'O  H nt  g Hu  ns'.
Odd.

missions.name: hunthumans
missions.description:
... 'In s  king nd tr  k ng your qu   y, it s  mp rt nt to be aw re  f scent.
 he  atura  t ail  f ph rom nes, decays over time.
Where a sc  t is suf  cien  y fr  h, on  may h#nt  r f$nd the b st dir ctio   n wh ch to fo lo '...

Wow, this is really badly degraded. I'm sure there's something really useful hiding in here if you can just figure it out.

reward.message: You feel like you've learned something really valuable but still need to work out exactly how to use the skills you've just gained.

Brum. Bruuuum. BRRRRUUUUUUM!

missions.name: hidejimswig
missions.description: Make the wig 'go away'. Drag is amazing for some, but not for Jim.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'I've got a job for you if you're interested.'

dialogue.response:
'OK, here's the deal.'
'Earlier this year, Jim had all the sales managers wear fancy dress as a 'reward' for the team hitting their record numbers.'
'It was a great move but I swear we don't want a repeat of the horror of Jim in drag again.'
'Can you hide his wig for us? (preferably somewhere out of the building!)'
'Meh. Just remember who keeps us in business here.'
'OK. Maybe later?'

'Hi again $player.'
'Fancy that job now?'

'Remember. hide it somewhere outside if possible.'
'I'll leave this challenge in your capable hands.'
'Fine, forget I asked.'

'Well, if you're up for it, remember to hide it somewhere outside if possible.'
'I'll leave this little challenge in your capable hands.'

reward.message:
Great stuff! No more managers in drag.
I think Jim might be a little disappointed with you but Jared will have appreciated it.

inventory.name: clarissa rothwell
inventory.detailedDescription: She kicks ass on accounts, like many of the sales team, she's one of the reasons this place can afford to pay us all.

You're at the top of the Eastern back staircase. This is very much a path less-travelled.
From here you can take a short-cut down to the Sales and Marketing teams or South to Finance and Facilities.

name: second-floor-back-stairs-west
description: You're standing at the top of the west fire escape staircase.

name: second-floor-cubicle
description:
You're in a toilet cubicle. The toilet is making some unhealthy gugling noises and the smell in here is terrible.
I think there's a good reason this one was out of order.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: When you're finished...

inventory.name: latch
inventory.detailedDescription: It's useful to lock the door when you need a little extra privacy.

attributes.defaultResult: It's attached to the door. There's no obvious way to remove it.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: toilet
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like the maintenance team have been working on this one.

attributes.defaultResult:
You relieve yourself and flush the toilet...
Oh no, it's blocked!

The water slowly fills up to the brim of the bowl and stops just before the surface tension of the water gives way to disaster.
That was close!

There was a good reason why this cubicle was out of order.
As you recover your wits, the water slowly subsides back to normal levels.
When you get a chance, you might want to drop an anonymous maintenance request to the Facilities Team to sort your mess out.
attributes.smell: I'll leave it up to your imagination.

inventory.name: brush
inventory.detailedDescription: Be nice and clean up after yourself when you're done.

inventory.name: guardian newspaper
inventory.detailedDescription: Middle class pulp propaganda trash.

attributes.defaultResult: Blah blah government... blah scandal blah crucial blah liberal blah economics etc.

inventory.name: article on the boy scout principle
inventory.detailedDescription: It's entitled 'The Boy Scout Rule'.

missions.name: lotlboyscout
missions.description:
'Leave the campground cleaner than you found it'

The article goes on to describe some of the fundamentals of good coding practice. In particular; it focuses on leaving the code cleaner than you found it. Clean as you go, and pick up that one extra little piece of litter that was already there before you walk away.
If everyone on your team did that, on every check-in you'd be amazed how fast things improve.
Imagine! Your code actually improves over time rather than degrades!

You think back to other jobs you've had where people didn't clean up after themselves and feel a little sad.

(Imagine if the authors of this game did that all the time! But no... they're in the zone, coding away at 3am. Just one more commit before bed. Sure, it'll be fine without tests... Just this once.)

attributes.missionObject: article on the boy scout principle

reward.message: Congratulations. You've learned a simple approach to keeping code clean.

inventory.detailedDescription: Reinforced glass. As you'd expect in a typical office building.

name: second-floor-north-west-corridor-central
description: You're part-way along a roughly North-South running corridor in the North-West corner of the second floor. There are meeting rooms to the East and West.
synonyms: second floor north west corridor central

name: second-floor-north-west-corridor-north-central
description: You're in a roughly North-South running corridor in the North-West corner of the second floor.
synonyms: second floor north west corridor north central

name: second-floor-north-west-corridor-north-east
description: You're at a bend in a roughly North-South running corridor in the North-West corner of the second floor. There are meeting rooms to the North and East.
synonyms: second floor north west corridor north east

name: second-floor-north-west-corridor-north-end
description: You're in a North-South corridor at the North-West corner of the second floor. To the North is a staircase leading down.
synonyms: second floor north west corridor north end

name: second-floor-north-west-corridor-south
description:
You're at the South end of a roughly North-South running corridor in the North-West corner of the second floor.
There's meeting room to the West. To the east is a curved glass partition behind which are printers and a stationery cupboard.
synonyms: second floor north west corridor south

name: second-floor-printer-area
description: You're in a small glass-walled corner bounded by corridors.

inventory.name: cupboard
inventory.detailedDescription: Can haz all ur Scrum supplies.

attributes.extendedInventoryDescription: Amongst the mountains of redundant folders, staplers and pen holders you find $inventory that might be useful to you.

inventory.name: post-it pad
inventory.detailedDescription: A pack of multicoloured post-it notes.

inventory.name: notebook
inventory.detailedDescription:
An A4 'Black and Red' brand notebook.
These are really useful for keeping track of tasks.
In case you accidentally leave it somewhere, I strongly suggest you write your name in it though.

inventory.name: biro
inventory.detailedDescription: Not quite a sharpie but useful for taking notes.

inventory.name: sharpie
inventory.detailedDescription: Invaluable tool of the agilist.

inventory.name: batteries
inventory.detailedDescription: They're pretty chunky but fairly old-looking.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's enough for about $charges $chargeUnit of power

name: second-floor-reception
description: You're standing in the former reception area on the second floor. A CCTV camera looms over the desk area.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It leads out to the second floor stairs.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: second-floor-seating-area-east
description:
You're in a comfortable - if somewhat high-traffic - seating area.
The whole of one wall is taken up by a mural of giant post-it notes. You could stand here for hours reading them trying to spot the duplicates.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription:
I see it! I can see the duplicate...
Oh... No, it's not.

inventory.name: fire exit
inventory.detailedDescription: If you open the door, you'll probably set off an alarm.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're small but comfortable armchairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a small, wooden coffee table. Nothing particularly special.

name: second-floor-seating-area-west
description:
You're in a comfortable - if somewhat high-traffic - seating area.
Teams from the second floor tend to use this area for reading and relaxing.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're small but comfortable armchairs.

attributes.defaultResult: It's best to leave them here.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a small, wooden coffee table. Nothing particularly special.

name: second-floor-toilet
description:
You're in a bathroom. You can't quite remember what floor you're on.
Do those soap dispensers look different to you?
There's a tatty-looking sign on the toilet cubicle door.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: Shiny and clean.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: mirror
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer closely at yourself in the mirror and wonder if perhaps the Porta Rossa diet is getting to you a little.

inventory.name: hand dryer
inventory.detailedDescription: These things are good but loud.

attributes.defaultResult:
You wave your hands under the dryer. Annoyingly it cuts out too early.
It smells like it might be overheating.
attributes.smell: It has that reassuring, safe smell of ozone and burned electrics.

inventory.name: soap
inventory.detailedDescription: Your mind must be playing tricks on you, it's just the same as all the others.

attributes.defaultResult: You push the top of the dispenser. With a little bit of slipping and repositioning you manage to lather and wash your hands.

inventory.name: cubicle door
inventory.detailedDescription: The lock on the door has a slot to allow turning from the outside with a suitable tool.

inventory.name: sign
inventory.detailedDescription: It says 'Temporarily out of order'.

attributes.defaultResult: It says: 'Due to a series of blockages and poor plumbing, this cubicle is currently out of order'.

inventory.name: basin
inventory.detailedDescription: Clean and with a supply of fresh water.

attributes.defaultResult: You rinse your face and hands in the sink. You feel clean and refreshed.

delivers.name: water
delivers.detailedDescription: No real nutritional value but great for thirst and plants.

attributes.smell: It's odorless
attributes.taste:
They always taught you in science class that water was tasteless and odorless. That's probably true for 'pure' water but this tastes just like water.
You wrestle with the idea of explaining what purified water tastes like to someone else but settle for accepting it's just water.

delivers.name: healthy tomato plants
delivers.detailedDescription: They're well watered and fruiting.

inventory.name: tomatoes
inventory.detailedDescription: They're ripe and ready to pick.

attributes.defaultResult:
You'll need to ask Francesca if you want her tomatoes.
If you wait around long enough, I'm sure she'll be back.
attributes.smell: It's funny, freshly picked tomatoes always seem to smell like cat pee to you.
attributes.taste: They taste red. It's an odd thing to say but they really do.

name: second-floor-west-corridor
description:
You're in a short corridor that runs East-West. To the East is the second floor reception area.
To the north is a printer area that also houses a stationary cupboard. To the west lies the People team (and more winding corridors).

name: servery-back-corridor
description: You're in the back corridor of the SQL Servery. There's a slight smell of industrial kitchens here.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It leads out to the first floor landing.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: servery-food-bar
description:
You're standing by the SQL Servery serving area and salad bar.
It's breakfast time. The kitchen team have laid out a breakfast spread of fruit and porridge.

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain round china bowl

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain round china bowl

inventory.name: bowl
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain round china bowl

inventory.name: vat
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a large stainless steel cooking vat

attributes.defaultResult: It belongs here for the benefit of all staff, not just you.

inventory.name: porridge
inventory.detailedDescription:
A great, healthy, warm start to the day.
A bowl of this should keep you going until lunchtime.

attributes.smell: It smells warm and comforting.
attributes.taste: It's 'just right'. First time too, no need for any additional salt or sugar here.

name: servery-kitchen
description: You're in the SQL Servery kitchen.

inventory.name: rum bottle
inventory.detailedDescription: A large rum bottle

inventory.name: quality rum
inventory.detailedDescription:
Now that's the good stuff!
It looks like someone may have got their drinks mixed up. This is too good for cooking with.

attributes.smell: This is definitely the good stuff. Admittedly it's not barrel-aged but it's a great smelling spiced rum with a strong scent of vanilla and a hint of lime, cinammon and nutmeg
attributes.taste:
You sip gently at the rum. It's deicious.
You never really envision spiced rum as a neat sipping drink but this is worth savouring.

inventory.name: jar
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a brown plastic jar (they used to be glass once upon a time).

inventory.name: marmite
inventory.detailedDescription: Love it or hate it - your choice, but it is full of b-vitamins

attributes.smell: It's tricky to describe. It smells pungent and yeasty but in quite a comforting way.
attributes.taste: It's strong, salty and makes your tongue sting slightly. You're not quite sure if you like it or not but you find it oddly tasty.

inventory.name: melanie sheldon
inventory.detailedDescription:
A true ray of sunshine every lunchtime. Serving you food on a daily basis.
Seriously - she's lovely and looks out for all of us.

missions.name: lunchtime
missions.description: Melanie has prepared a tasty roast for you.

modifyLocations.name: servery-food-bar
modifyLocations.description:
You're in the SQL Servery serving area and lunch is being served.
You know how there's no such thing as a free lunch right?
It's not entirely true. Lunch is free here as long as you're reasonable with how much you take.

inventory.name: roast
inventory.detailedDescription: The team have outdone themselves. It's roast turkey with all the trimmings and yorkshire pudding.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's about $charges $chargeUnit of everything left but we'd prefer you only stuck to one helping so that everyone can eat and we can maintain our budget
attributes.smell: It's like new year and thanksgiving all rolled into one. The smell gives you a wonderful sense of well-being.
attributes.taste: Amazing! A complete free roast dinner never tasted so good.

inventory.name: nut roast
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's got all the trimmings of a full roast dinner (even roasted tomatoes) and it's also veggie friendly.
A very hearty meal!

attributes.smell: It's like a vegetarian new year and thanksgiving all rolled into one. The smell gives you a wonderful sense of well-being.
attributes.taste: Amazing! A complete free roast dinner without meat never tasted so good.

inventory.name: salad
inventory.detailedDescription: It's got mixed leaves, some cheese, beans, tomatoes, and beetroot. All with a French dressing.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's plenty of assorted salad items left but we'd prefer you only stuck to one plateful
attributes.smell: It smells fresh and (mostly) green It's better than you'd find in many restaurants.
attributes.taste: Hmm. Crisp and fresh. You're not sure if you're a huge fan of salad or not but it tastes as good as you'd hope a salad would really..

synonyms: plateful of selection of salad items

fail.message:
Hey, stop that. Be reasonable with how much food you're taking. Everyone else needs to eat too.
As a basic guideline, It's soup & salad, soup & roast or salad & roast.

modifyLocations.name: servery-main
modifyLocations.description: You're in the SQL Servery. The smell of food and buzz of conversation are almost enough to overload your senses. It looks like everyone descended on the canteen at the same time for lunch.

inventory.name: smell of food
inventory.detailedDescription: You'll need to head to the serving area.

attributes.defaultResult: The food serving area is just East of here. Go help yourself but don't go overboard, everyone needs to be able to eat.
attributes.smell:
It smells like roast dinner day. There's usually meat and vegetarian options.
Gotta love the free food in this place!

attributes.detailedDescription: It's a large stainless steel cooking vat

inventory.name: soup
inventory.detailedDescription: It's tasty and exotic - spicy butternut squash and coconut.

attributes.chargesDescription: There's about $charges $chargeUnit left. For the benefit of everyone else, try to stick to just one portion though
attributes.smell: It has a lovely aromatic smell. A mix of both sweet and spicy.
attributes.taste: Yep, it's good.

reward.message:
It's time to enjoy the wonders of our kitchen and the results of all your help so far.
The food they provide here is pretty amazing.

missions.name: tomatoesformelanie
missions.displayName: get some fresh tomatoes for Melanie
missions.description: Melanie needs some fresh tomatoes for making lunch.

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'We've got a minor catering emergency.'
'Our regular vegetable delivery has let us down and we're out of tomatoes.'
'If we don't get some soon, we'll not be able to feed everyone lunch.'
'Could you see if Francesca can spare any of hers?'

dialogue.response: 'Thanks $player.'
'Well, you're not very helpful are you.'
'Let me know if you can track some down.'
'Any sign of those tomatoes yet?'
'Excellent!'
'I won't ask again but I'm sure everyone would appreciate it if you can help.'

reward.message:
Melanie says 'Thankyou so much $player.'
'We can go ahead with lunch for everyone as planned.' 'I'll make sure there's a special roast waiting for you too!'

inventory.name: will stockton
inventory.detailedDescription: Chef Will, master of the Porta Rossa dessert!

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

name: servery-main
description: You're in the SQL Servery. It's still early enough in the morning for a few of the staff here to be wandering past to get their breakfasts.

inventory.name: fire exit
inventory.detailedDescription: If you open the door, you'll probably set off an alarm.

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: They're stackable chairs that allow the entire space to be cleared for company-wide presentations.

attributes.defaultResult: They need to be left out for now.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription:
These are quite neat. They have a wipe-clean surface and they fold away so that the area can be cleared
Despite them being able to fold they're also pretty sturdy.

attributes.defaultResult: Other people will still want to use the tables today. Best to leave them as they are.

inventory.name: breakfast
inventory.detailedDescription: You'll need to head to the serving area for breakfast.

attributes.defaultResult: The food serving area is just East of here. Go help yourself but don't go overboard, everyone needs to be able to eat.
attributes.smell: There's a warm comforting smell coming from the serving area to the East.

name: servery-north-west
description:
You're standing at the North-West corner of the servery. The walls here are decorated with postcards and photos.
This is the main thoroughfare for staff heading to and from the servery at lunchtimes.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It leads out to the second floor landing.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.description: wall full of post cards and photos
inventory.detailedDescription:
You poke through the postcards interspersed with the photos. They generally have variations of 'thanks', 'you're wonderful' and similar meaningful platitudes.

You're tempted to take one of these to give to someone.

attributes.defaultResult: Taking just the one postcard was enough.

inventory.name: photo
inventory.detailedDescription:
The photos are all full of people smiling and enjoying themselves.
Even from the short time you've been here, you now recognise a few of the faces here.

attributes.defaultResult: These are part of Porta Rossa's 'Memory wall'. They're here to look at and enjoy, not to mess with.

inventory.name: postcard
inventory.detailedDescription: Someone's written a message on this one.

attributes.defaultResult:
It says thanks for being great! (isn't that nice). There are loads of others with similar thank-yous on them.
I reckon you could give this to someone to let them know they're appreciated.

name: servery-south-west
description: You're in the South-West corner of the servery. The lights of network switches and wiring looms blink silently at you, enticing you to play with the wires.

inventory.name: wires
inventory.detailedDescription:
Blinky blink blink, whirrrr, hum, blink.
It's just your typical network hardware. It's cool that you can get to it though.

defaultResult.message:
You poke and pull at the wires whilst inwardly grinning to yourself at the fun you think you're having at others' expense.
As you tug away, the lights around you flicker and you receive a painful electric shock.
Sometimes I wonder if you're as smart as you think you are.

name: shower-ground-floor
description: You're in the ground floor showers. There's a lingering smell of deodorant, damp and cyclist sweat.

inventory.name: trainers
inventory.detailedDescription: These look pretty large. You're probably looking for a relatively tall owner for these.

attributes.defaultResult: They're far too big for you. Probably best to track down their rightful owner and reunite them.

name: signpost
description: You're in the SignPost meeting room.

name: smoking-area
description: You're outside the back of the office under the fire escape.

inventory.name: fire door
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a secure door. These kinds of doors usually only open from the inside.

inventory.name: steel gate
inventory.detailedDescription: It leads to the rear fire escape.

inventory.name: cat
inventory.detailedDescription: It looks like a stray. I wonder if it's hungry?

defaultResult.message:
As you reach down to pick the cat up it turns, lashes out at you and backs away out of your reach.
I don't think it wants to be picked up.

attributes.smell: As you bend down and sniff the cat, it lashes out at you.

inventory.name: bench
inventory.detailedDescription: A comfortable spot to sit and rest for a while.

inventory.name: lighter
inventory.detailedDescription: It's quite a nice old cigarette lighter. Someone must have lost or forgotten it.

attributes.chargesDescription: Annoyingly, it's impossible to tell how much gas there is left in it.
attributes.defaultResult:
You strike the flint a few times and see a small flicker of flame. It gutters out quickly.
You'd best only use it to light things when you really need to as you can't see an obvious way to refill it when it's empty.

inventory.name: pack
inventory.detailedDescription:
These days all the identifying information on cigarette packets is obscured by health warnings, they could be anybody's and any brand.
They're bad for your heath - but you know that already, right?

inventory.name: cigarette
inventory.detailedDescription: A cancer stick as your folks used to call them.

attributes.defaultResult: $action light

inventory.name: cigarette
inventory.detailedDescription: A cancer stick as your folks used to call them.

attributes.defaultResult: $action light

inventory.name: cigarette
inventory.detailedDescription: A cancer stick as your folks used to call them.

attributes.defaultResult: $action light

inventory.name: cigarette
inventory.detailedDescription: A cancer stick as your folks used to call them.

attributes.defaultResult: $action light

inventory.name: cigarette
inventory.detailedDescription: A cancer stick as your folks used to call them.

attributes.defaultResult: $action light

name: snorting-horses
description:
You're in the Snorting Horses meeting room.
There's a great view out of the windows. The table has been rendered to look like straw, one wall is covered in rosettes whilst the other mixes acoustic treatment with some rather alarming horse-head-shaped lighting.
Overall there's something deeply unsettling about spending time alone in here.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a long way down.

name: southeast-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're at the South-East intersection of two corridors on the ground floor.

name: southwest-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're in the South-West corner intersection of two corridors of the ground floor. There is a meeting room to the West.

name: spiderman
description:
You're in the Spiderman meeting room. (Or is that Spider-man?) There are large windows on 2 walls.
You feel somewhat exposed here

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: It's the usual view out of the front of the office.

name: stairs-first-floor
description: You're halfway up the main office staircase.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's one of the main doors into the first floor working area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: stairs-ground-floor
description:
You're standing at the foot of the stairs.
Looking up at the glass marvel you can't help noticing that something seems slightly off about it.
(Like maybe it was designed by a slightly shifty rogue AI.)

To the West lies a small kitchen and refreshement area. The rest of the atrium and reception are to the East.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's one of the main doors into the ground floor working area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: stairs-second-floor
description: You're standing at the top of the main staircase The view's great from up here.

inventory.name: office door
inventory.detailedDescription:
It's one of the main doors into the second floor working area.
Like most modern office building doors it closes (and locks) automatically.

name: support-east
description:
You're in support area.
From here you can make rude gestures and wave through the window at passers-by on the stairs.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: Wave!

attributes.defaultResult:
You press your face to the glass and make childish signs through the window.
Nobody seems to notice and you feel a little foolish.

inventory.name: gesture
inventory.detailedDescription: You flap your arms and prance about staring at yourself.

attributes.defaultResult:
You press your face to the glass and make childish signs through the window.
Nobody seems to notice and you feel a little foolish.

name: support-west
description: You're in the support area.

inventory.name: chris abbott
inventory.detailedDescription: Support and music skills. What more could you need?

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

name: thinking-hats
description: You're in the Thinking Hats meeting room. The seats in here are really tricky to pick up and move and it's oddly chilly. Perhaps it's haunted?

name: top-fire-escape
description:
You're at the top of the rear fire escape. From here you have a short climb up to the roof.
It's a long way down!

name: traffic-jam-meeting-room
description:
You're in the 'Traffic Jam' meeting room.
There's quite a good view outside from here although it does feel like a bit of a fishbowl.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer out of the window and look down to the office entrance.

name: war-room
description:
You're in the War room. Once upon a time this was a little-used library. It's a long narrow space that's not used for management stand-ups.
The walls are filled with long-forgotten organisational restructuring plans.

name: waste-area
description: You're by a locked gate. On the far side are a series of waste containers full of carboard boxes, broken furniture and kitchen leftovers.

inventory.name: peter jacobs
inventory.detailedDescription: He's one of the hidden heroes of our catering team.

inventory.name: keyfob
inventory.detailedDescription: Carrying this ensures you have access to the office whenever you need.

inventory.name: gate key
inventory.detailedDescription: This looks like the key to the waste area gate.

inventory.name: waste gate
inventory.detailedDescription: You've always been curious about what interesting things get thrown in here.

name: web-meeting-room
description:
You're in 'Web'. When not in use for small meetings this room doubles as an in-office hairdressing salon.
The carpet in here feels strange underfoot.

inventory.name: floor
inventory.detailedDescription: On the surface it's just a plain office carpet but it's a bit prickly.

attributes.defaultResult:
As you undo your trousers and squat, you consider the implication of your actions and decide you don't feel like being sacked today.
Repeat after me, 'I am not the phantom pooper.'
Time to tidy yourself up and learn to behave like a reasonable person.

inventory.name: hair
inventory.detailedDescription:
Fine hair trimmings of assorted colours and thickness.
None look long enough to do anything useful with.

attributes.defaultResult: They're too fine and embedded into the carpet to collect.

name: west-bike-racks
description: You're at the South-West corner of the the office building.

inventory.name: bike racks
inventory.detailedDescription: There's dozens of bikes here but most of them are locked.

attributes.extendedInventoryDescription: After extensively picking through the crowded racks, you find $inventory.

inventory.name: old bike
inventory.detailedDescription: It's yours. Yay :D

attributes.defaultResult: $action ride

name: west-car-park
description:
You're in the West car park.
To the South are bike racks and a path running across the back of the Porta Rossa office building.

missions.name: saveportarossa
missions.displayName: save Porta Rossa from the zombie contagion
missions.description:
The scene of devastation nearby looks very bad - almost like the zombie apocalypse is starting...
You need to ensure everyone survives somehow. Act quickly!

reward.message:
Congratulations. You and the rest of Porta Rossa survived a potential zombie apocalypse!
Now things can return to normal - right?
(That could have been very nasty).
But...
What caused the crash? Did someone sabotage the flight?

fail.message:
Oh no! You weren't quick enough to save everyone.
Even in just the opening hours of the zombie apocalypse our near and dear are falling.
You'd best get on with cleaning up the mess and making sure it doesn't get any worse.

name: west-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're near the South end of the West corridor of the ground floor.

name: west-end-south-corridor-ground-floor
description: You're near the West end of the South corridor on the ground floor.
synonyms: west end south corridor ground floor

name: windows-meeting-room
description:
You're in the 'Windows' meeting room.
It's a bit of a misnomer really as the meeting room next door has more windows. Perhaps it's just irony.
The room's slightly cramped but you can just about fit four people in here for a short meeting.
One of the walls is oddly curved for no obvious reason.

inventory.name: window
inventory.detailedDescription: You peer out of the window and look down to the office entrance.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a concave curve. Possibly so that people walking past the outside don't walk into a corner. (We're speculating here)

inventory.name: whiteboard
inventory.detailedDescription: As whiteboards go it's pretty average really.

inventory.name: pen
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a green pen.

inventory.name: table
inventory.detailedDescription: It's a plain white melamine meeting room table.
synonyms: plain white melamine meeting room table

inventory.name: chairs
inventory.detailedDescription: Yup, they're chairs.

attributes.defaultResult: Sorry, they belong in here.
